name: Careful 'n Selective
review_text: I had wanted a single serving coffee maker for a very long time, and even though I had been leaning toward the well-known Keurig brand, I was still open-minded to other products.
review_title: Now I Own TWO - I love my Keurig K15 - Reliable, Fast Easy Usage, No Cleanup, and an Excellent Brew
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: BC360
review_text: My wife and I were looking for something that took up less space on our counter while we were living in an apartment waiting for our house to be built... the Keurig K15.  It's compact and doesn't take up nearly as much space as my K55.  There are three minor setbacks that you should be aware of.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I bought this in March and now the water no longer flows correctly from the tube.  It fills with water as people don't know it's not working and floods the place.  I've tried cleaning but it still clogs up.  I'm guessing it's because the poker and the tube are to close and coffee grinds keep getting sucked up into the system.  This is just a guess mind you.  I don't know how this got the high rating it did.  Of course it's past the return policy.  I do love the design or look of it but now it's basically a paperweight.  My clients also complained the water just did not get hot enough.  Ste
review_title: I'm guessing it's because the poker and the tube are to close and coffee grinds keep getting sucked up into the system
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kathy
review_text: I had a larger Keurig before buying this one. I like this one much better. It takes up much less space on the counter and I actually like that water doesn't sit in it all the time. There are measuring indicators inside that tell you where the 6, 8, and 10oz level is, but I find it easier to just fill up my cup and pour it in. It is quiet, fast, and shuts off automatically after 90 seconds of non use.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I am super unhappy with this Keurig.  I have been a long-time user of Keurig coffee makers, but this one just does not cut the mustard.  Unfortunately, because we bought it for our RV, we did not test it in time to meet the NARROW window of return opportunity.  What is that about????  The plastic was cheap, the coffee was cold, and the functionality was awkward.  We feel duped.
review_title: Keurig.....So You Think You Can Trust A Brand Name?!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Utility Power Engineer
review_text: I have bought four Keurig coffee machines in that last 63 months, and used each to brew four cups of coffee per day - not a heavy burden for a machine costing this much.  None has lasted more than two years and each lasted a shorter time than the previous one.  This lastest, bought last Oct 16 according to Amazon's records, lasted just 121 days - almost exactly a third of a year.  Having to replace them at a rate of three per year seems rather extreme, so I've given up on Keurig now and bought something else that brews K-cups.  I'll see if it lasts longer - I hope.
review_title: I have bought four Keurig coffee machines in that last ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Too Fond Of Books
review_text: I purchased this mini Keurig to take with me when I visit my son, who doesn't drink coffee. I must have my morning coffee!  (Keurig needs to make a travel case!)  It also saved the day when the carafe broke on our regular coffee pot -- I used it until the replacement carafe arrived.  It is easy to use and brews quickly.  The drain tray is removable to accommodate taller mugs (see photo), but I wish it would accept more than 10 oz. of water so that you can better adjust the strength of the coffee. I haven't had any quality problems so far, using it intermittently.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: G. Scott
review_text: Editing my review based on our experience.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: OhioJLo
review_text: I owned a B145 OfficePro Keurig for six years, and used it almost every day at least 3 times--much more with frequent houseguests, and the switches were finally starting to get wonky, so I replaced it with this one. All the things about a Keurig machine that I like are in this model:
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Rapid Reader
review_text: This coffee maker is awful. We have gone thru 4 or more of them and each one craps out after minimal use. This last one only made it for less than a month. Will try another brand this time. Not sure what the problem here is. We live at 7500 feet so don't know if the altitude has something to do with it, but I get tired of sending them back to Keurig.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Tracy Spalding
review_text: I got this for my desk at work and it is small enough to not make that big of an impact on my desktop real-estate. To use it you have to pour water into the reservoir every time and make sure you are putting in the exact amount you want. It doesn t measure for you like other keurigs do, and won t store water in a reservoir like the larger ones. It uses the same K-Cups as all the other keurigs and it produces the same quality hot beverages as the larger keurigs.
review_title: It doesn t measure for you like other keurigs do
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Houston
review_text: Don't waste your time and money!!! My 30 day return window closed 3 days ago and the unit just powered off and will not power on again. Checked all circuits  and tried another outlet to no avail. Also purchased reusable My K-Cup filter, paper filters and my wife today purchased from Costco about 3 months supply of K-cup coffee pods. Back to the old Tossimo that's 5 years old and works perfectly.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: ihopie
review_text: This product is only a month old and the water isn't getting as hot as it did in the beginning. Big mistake. Now I have to look for a better product. Of course all packaging has been thrown out so I can't return it. Don't suggest anyone buy this if you want hot coffee.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: DebD
review_text: Second Keurig, prior was larger model and I liked the concept of a small version.  Just got in April, now just over 4 months later stopped working.  Figured I was unlucky and got a lemon.  Before ordering a replacement I read the reviews and saw the same issue over and over.  Pump failed, only makes a teaspoon of coffee now.  Should last much longer than 4-5 months of use.  Won't reorder this model.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: David S
review_text: This coffeemaker works as expected and produces a great cup of coffee everytime. I thougth the reservoir was going to hold more than one cup of water, but it is not something that I would complain about. I just would have wanted to know that before purchasing the product. So, for those interested in this product, know that this unit does not come with a reserve tank for water. You pour in the amount of water you want to brew. I use the cup I plan on drinking out of to measure out the amount of water, fill the machine with it, turn the machine on, insert my k-cup and hit the start button. It's a simple process that doesn't take long at all.
review_title: This machine brews a great single cup of coffee.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Rabid Prototypes
review_text: This was the first Keurig I've purchased and while I was excited when I initially unboxed it, my excitement soon turned to disappointment.
review_title: Convenient, but unreliable, and makes weak, expensive, lukewarm coffee!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Bonnie Raiford
review_text: I was hesitant to purchase this Keurig based on the reviews. Reviewers either loved it or hated it.  I wanted something simple for brewing just one fresh cup in the evening so I didn't have to reheat the morning brew from my drip coffeemaker. I was also wasting coffee. I also wanted to be able to brew using my own coffee so I purchased the most recent version of the K-Cup reusable filter.  I am in the early stages of using it but so far I'm impressed.  I've made 8 ounces of coffee and 10 ounces. The taste has been excellent, the temperature about the same as my drip machine. It is easy to use. I did call Keurig when setting it up because this unit did not have the 6-8-10 measuring unit on the left side that I saw in some videos.  I thought it was missing.  I was told that came in the prior K-10 Model of this series.  The nice lady at Keurig did recommend using a coarse coffee grind because fine grinds will clog the system. I use filtered water so hopefully that will keep maintenance of the unit minimal.  If you are looking for a one cup at a time not to exceed 10 ounces brewer this will fill your needs. This review is based on me using the K-cup reusable filter which is easy to use.  I will update this review if the unit fails in any way and if I do try the K-cup Pods.  My recommendation is to take any reviews you read with a grain of salt.  There are so many variables that affect the performance of a coffeemaker. Also know the limitations of your product before you purchase it.
review_title: Leap of Faith Purchase - Read on!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Jules
review_text: Love it! So perfect for on the go mornings. Only downside is that most of my mugs don't fit the space. Just make sure you have short mugs!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: D. E. Adams
review_text: We've had a 1.0 almost from the day they were released and it has worked extremely well. Easy to operate and keep clean, but it finally quit. This model arrived today and the first thing we noticed was the MUCH shorter power chord which necessitated rearranging our kitchen counter to accommodate it. It was also much larger and wider than our original model and the "artwork" on the Amazon page. We used to close the lid and hit the brew button to start a cup. Now, you have to wait for the water to drain down into another, secondary tank before you can close the lid and hit the brew button. Why? What practical purpose does this serve? None, that I can see. Furthermore, there was a clear "fill level" line in our original model. NOT in this one, so, to avoid over-filling the reservoir, you have to pre-measure each and every cup to avoid overflowing and creating a mess! Another waste of time! When time is of the essence, getting out the door in the morning with a fresh, hot cup of coffee in hand, this design disappoints! Very loud, too! This will be the last Keurig I buy! After just a few days of us it has quite working all together it will not even drop the water from the top into the lower reservoir at all...JUNK!!! Returning it for a full refund and buying a different brand! ZERO STARS!
review_title: JUNK! Take a simple easy to use design & make it complicated/difficult....& Now it has quite working...Last Kuerig I'll buy!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: The Happy Vampyr
review_text: The top reasons I bought one: small footprint; perfect for the weekends; on-board cord storage; easy use; machine minds it s own energy use; no waste with reusable filter; immediate reservoir draining (no storage).
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: marunger
review_text: Previously, I had a large Keurig for about 6 years before the motor went bad. Then I purchased this one. It died in about 2 months, Keurig replaced it. The second one went belly-up less than 3 months later. Keurig replace it. The third one lasted a little over a month. I am using the same water as I did with my first Keurig...the long-lasting one. I have followed all the "online" and phone advice from the company.My conclusion is that Keurig has cut corners in manufacturing. What's the line from a famous movie? "I'm mad as H-- and I'm not going to take it any more."  I strongly advise customers to re-think buying this product.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: RtRadke
review_text: I was looking forward to receiving this machine, but I'm now very disappointed with it.  I just received it, and I have tried turning the machine on multiple times.  The "add water" button doesn't flash after pressing the "on" button, but a faint hum can be heard coming from the machine while it's plugged in.  I have tried changing the outlet that it's plugged into, opening/closing the pod holder, pressing the "on" button, and pressing the "brew" button many many times.  Will probably be returning this machine in the next few days if I can't figure out the problem.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: sunquilter
review_text: I bought this keurig for our motorhome.  This is the morning of our third day of camping and our third morning of using this coffee maker.  NO COFFEE.  It is brewing, but nothing is coming out.  I have bought three of the large keurig coffee makers before for our home.  They don't last.  It's a waste of money.  I use bottled water only and the breakfast blend from Costco.
review_title: Will never buy a Keurig again!!!!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: L. Talan
review_text: I had my last Single Serve for 5 years with no problems.  I replaced it because the water well was showing some wear and tear.  I have had this "new" one for less than 3 months and it broke.  What the heck?!  The water won't drain. We are looking up how to fix this, but we shouldn't have to.  This is ridiculous.  Did they just stop caring about their products?  Are they cutting corners with their manufacturing?  This one was cheaper than the last one I got.  I would happily pay $30 more for a machine that works.  Very frustrated.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Snubnosed in Alpha
review_text: It was kind of nice while it lasted, but it only lasted about a week.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: rj
review_text: UPDATE: BROKEN and INOPERABLE!!!!! On 11/23/2017 After 4 Month s of Weekday Use
review_title: UPDATE: BROKEN and INOPERABLE!!!!! After 4 Months!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: katywat
review_text: I initially gave this a 5-star review, but have had to update it. I am a huge fan of the full-size Keurig, and wanted to use my K cups when visiting my non-coffee-drinking Dad. So I bought this single-serve unit to keep at his home. And it worked great until after using it about 10 times, it stopped working. This was the second time I purchased one of these poorly made products. The first time, I bought it for my office and it leaked water right off the bat. But you know, there s always a unit here or there that will be defective. But after this fail, I will not give it a third chance.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Casey Kelly
review_text: I had one of these for our office for four years and it worked great, and finally tapped out. So I figured four years was a great run for a little kuerig like this one and ordered another one.
review_title: first one lasted 4 years, second lasted 4 months.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Mom
review_text: Works perfectly for our RV.  We "tried" a press pot in RV but it's a mess..  That is no big deal in a home but on the road  a press pot is a pain.  This little guy is not heavy,  uses very little counter space and stores easily.  Getting the cups measured perfectly to prevent overflow took some getting used to.  It's not like the big Kurig that measures for you.  We 100% recommend this guy for RV travelers.  Small and gets the job done fast with zero cleanup.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Max Hunter
review_text: I love it - I had a regular classic that took up a lot of space and this one better suits my studio apartment that has very little counter space.  Some other reviewers complained about how long it takes to brew and not being able to use mugs.  I don't think it takes that long to brew - if you have a different model  with a reservoir and you start from it being off, it's about the same amount of time to heat up.  Yes - you cannot fit traveling mugs.  Large size mugs will fit OK if you remove the drip tray.  I also heard stories about dirt/mold that builds up in the reservoir of the classic version of the Keurig's, so I kind of like that this one doesn't have that.  So far - I'm loving it.  The coffee itself - doesn't seem as strong as a regular version but not bad overall.
review_title: I love it.  Compact but fits my small studio apartment.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Joan Piwowar
review_text: Don't know what the deal is. I received this on Tuesday. It was a replacement for one that I had used for the past 4 years that finally went kaput. I have only used it for 2 days and suddenly the water is not coming out and filling my cup. This was happening with my first one, but only after using it for years. The holes should not be plugged yet. It will brew one cup just fine, and the next, the water barely drips into the cup before it shuts off. I do not want to have to deal with returning such a largish item, but I guess I will have to.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kindle Customer
review_text: Delivered December 15th, 2017. Bought for my Wife for the holidays. Quit working April 10th, 2018. The pump runs as normal, and all of the light indicators work as normal, but no coffee comes out of the unite. My Wife used this for less than four months, Needless to say, this is unacceptable service from what I consider to be an expensive piece of plastic. The Amazon return period is over. Now we must go to Keurig to see whether they will back their product. The prospect of getting another one of these short-lived devices leaves me underwhelmed. Judging by the number of one star reviews, many others have have had the same experience as we have. Edited to add: We decided to throw this K15 away, rather than turn it in and get someone else's refurbished junk.I told my Wife that no more Keurig junk would ever cross our threshold again. We bought a Chulux to replace it and are quite happy with it.
review_title: Died after 3 1/2 months of use -- how dismal!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: JENNIFER E.
review_text: Perfect size. Works great. I'm addicted!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: A. Caruso
review_text: A few months ago I bought two of this model to replace an older one not working all the time for two different locations. Like my older one this newer one, both of them, will not brew sometimes...nothing comes out. I have cleaned them with vinegar, I have watched the youtube videos about taking it apart, I took compressed air for the needle opening. Sometimes they just will not brew. I thought maybe I got out of sequence with the water, coffee, lid closing, or something.  I am frustrated and disappointed.  It is not easy to take this apart but most importantly to me is why. Why should I have to watch a youtube video, take tools, take apart just to have a cup of coffee in the morning?? Is that really thinking of me the customer? My convenience? Don't buy this until they work this out. You get about 3 months out of it. Yes I have cleaned it, Yes I cleaned the needle. Used vinegar and took the inside hose off to clean!!! No working  consistently.
review_title: It may seem easy to take apart and clean but is that what the customer needs to do?
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Robblynn
review_text: I had previously had good experiences with Keurigs.  I liked the color so I purchased it.  It takes a long time to heat the water and leaks every single time I use it.  It is a fail!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Gerret Hayslip
review_text: Pretty great little coffee brewer, I m not one to drink a lot of coffee at once so this is perfect. Mine did not come with the plastic cup measurement guide that goes in the water reservoir but there s really no need for it. The pot brews exactly the amount of water poured into it. I haven t had any issues that others have mentioned.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Lorraine
review_text: This is the 5th Keurig K 15 I have purchased . I gave them as gifts , and bought one for home and one for the cottage . If this kind of repeat purchase doesn't scream "I LOVE THIS MACHINE " then I just don't what to tell you . I like the idea of fresh water for each cup . No left over flat water ever . Also the machine heats the water and servers your coffee in 90 sec. and it is hotter than any brewer that has been keeping the water hot all day .
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Deborah Fochler
review_text: We bought this April 2017 and have used it everyday. It makes the best coffee and easy to use. Doesnt take a lot of room on the counter and is perfect. Yesterday morning, Feb 10, 2017 it decided to not work. No warning at all. Put in water and coffee pressed button - nothing. No light nothing at all. So we moved to a different plug - still wont work.  I purchased a 3 year extra warranty thru Asurion and emailed them. Within minutes I got a return call and they told me to call Keurigs 800 number. So I did. The guy was wonderful, apologized and said they would send me a new coffee maker within 3 days. I was shocked expecting a run around and got none. Nothing but help.
review_title: Great coffee maker - even when it has an issue
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: andyoctober
review_text: This is a good coffee maker. It hasn't leaked; it gets the water very hot; it's attractive. Keep in mind - 12 oz (the most this machine can do) is not a lot. Your big to go cup holds more. Also, measure the height of your cups! This will not handle a cup that's more than about 4.5", and that is with the bottom section removed. I found a very nice to go cup at Target that fits perfectly- brand is called Bueno.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Regular Guy Mike
review_text: Nothing earth shattering here, it brews a cup of coffee, but there are some things that could be better. If you are looking for something that is portable, and something you are only going to use on occasion, then this is probably for you. Whatever you do, don't bring your travel mug, it won't fit under the dispenser. Even if you take the drip tray out, a travel mug will not fit under the dispenser. You can still brew a 10 ounce cup of coffee as long as it's not a taller cup. So if you want to use your travel mug, you have to brew into a shorter 10 ounce cup, and then pour it into your travel mug and you're on your way. I only use this one rarely, so that's not a deal breaker for me, but if you are in a hurry, it's a little bit of a pain. Also, after you put water in, you have to wait a little bit before the water warms up to dispense. It's not as quick as your regular Keurig. The last downside is that it doesn't heat the water as hot as a regular Keurig.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Paul Basken
review_text: Felt very cheap and plastic from the beginning, and it stopped working after a few weeks with barely any use, and Amazon will not take it back or replace it, hiding behind the fact that it was really sold to us by some other vendor, called "Bargain Ben," and "Bargain Ben" won't even respond to any queries.  Big mistake to trust Amazon or "Bargain Ben" -- any normal reputable merchant would at least look at the thing to evaluate it.
review_title: Plastic junk that failed, and Amazon too cheap to stand by it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: jerrybrn
review_text: Lukewarm coffee. I have to reheat it right as soon as it is brewed. I have tried every option I can think of to get hot coffee, but nothing works. I have a full-size Keurig that I am very happy with. I bought this one for travel. The size is ideal, but I like truly hot, black coffee. I'll go back to the big one.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: TK
review_text: Water does not get hot enough to brew properly. Only 160 degrees coming out of machine. My older B31 is 190 degrees. Plastic casing is cheaply made. One of the plastic nubs on the bottom that keeps the machine level was broken off in shipping. Casing scratches very easily. Color is only on surface so white shows thru and makes scratches look worse. Not worth the price. Returning this one and keeping my old B31 with the safety kit. On top of all that I found out this coffee maker has a Proposition 65 warning on it. Maybe I got a lemon??
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Gina Rappa
review_text: I was really excited about getting this product because it was small and would take up less counter space in my small home.  Once I recieved it I set it up right away.  I followed the directions and when I came to the part on how to fill the reservoir I was a bit confused because it referred to "the Water Level Guide".  I thought the level guide was something that was marked on the inside of the reservoir.  So I just wound up using a measuring cup to measure out the amount of water I needed.  After having it for almost 2 weeks I felt this was a little inconvenient and I wasn't getting a full cup of coffee so i watched a Youtube video on how to fill the reservoir.  That's when I found out that there was a piece missing from my coffee maker.  I still had the original box and packing material which I went through to make sure I just overlooked it.  It was not included which makes me believe that this was a refurbished coffee maker and not NEW as described.  I have no other way to contact the seller to find out if they can send me the piece I need.
review_title: Check to make sure everything is encluded
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: M. Chavez
review_text: AS OF THIS WRITING 28% OF PEOPLE HAVE LEFT A REVIEW OF 3 STARS OR LESS.
review_title: The worst part is it was only used < 30 times
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Sandi S.
review_text: I purchased this after my full size Keurig broke.  Only one person in the house drinks coffee so I thought the smaller one would be great.  This machine does not work well at all.  I continuously leaks water out and takes longer to heat up and brew the coffee.  For the money difference I wish that I had gotten another full size machine.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: USAussie
review_text: I got my Keurig K-Mini K15 in August 2017.  It was everything that I had hoped for after buying several substitutes and having to return them within 7-14 days!  It has been great for the entire time I had it until about 2 weeks ago and it just stopped dispensing coffee.  I had to turn it upside down to dump out the water.  I ran vinegar and water through it several times and then straight water another few times.  Bang, it was back in tip top shape (I thought.)
review_title: After 8 months it's starting to play up.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Ricco Suave
review_text: Never got a chance to try out this coffee maker.  When unpacking it, we noticed the Water Level Guide was missing.  So we returned the item.  This is the second coffee maker from this vendor that has arrived brand new in the box, but without the Water Level Guide.  And yes, we have read the reviews stating that someone had called the mfg, and the mfg stated that the guide does not come with this model.  That is incorrect.  We have seen display models with the guide, and the mfg instructions for the coffee maker describe and show the item in the owners manual.  It seems quite a few of these coffee makers were shipped from the vendor with this item missing.  We have tried this model out in a hotel, and it seemed to work fine.  Alas, this is not an Amazon issue, this is an issue from the manufacturer.
review_title: Keurig K-15 Coffee Maker - Maybe It Should Be Called the K-14
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Sandra Chapman
review_text: This pot is very, very loud. The cup portions are not consistent with the setting. And, I purchased this June 16, 2016 and it is totally broken as of Aug. 6, 2017 and the warrenty just expired little over a month ago.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Dawn O'Banion
review_text: I ordered this for the small footprint and low height (because it can be filled while sitting under the upper cabinet). These things are good. But I also need it to faithfully make good coffee, which it doesn't do. We ordered and returned one non-working pot thinking it might have just been a lemon. Still trusting the Keurig label, we ordered a second pot (same model). We have had the second one for a couple months and my husband just took it apart and cleaned it for the THIRD time because it wouldn't make coffee due to the tubes being plugged. We are using the same standard k-cups we used with our last keurig (with no problems ever). It also doesn't get the coffee hot enough, hence the flavor is not the best. We are very disappointed in this coffee pot, and in the fact that we gave it too much grace, then ended up stuck with a lousy machine that seems loaded with design flaws, and which we can no longer return. If you buy this coffee pot and have any HINT of a problem, return it immediately while you still can.
review_title: K Mini clogs frequently, doesn't get hot, makes poor coffee
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Ashleigh
review_text: This is absolutely amazing. I've wanted a Keurig for years and I just stumbled upon this while on my free trial of Amazon Prime. I was able to find one "used" but not even touched by anyone (like someone had returned it without opening it). It was in the original packaging and just absolutely gorgeous when I unboxed it!
review_title: Hands down, the BEST shipping experience.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Dale Reid
review_text: As a gift, the recipient was delighted with her first brewer.  But now that each pod is close to a buck a pop, and they haven't gotten the disposables to be degradable yet, I have my reservations.  I know the self fill baskets are available, but I struggle to get the proportions and grind correct to be able to kiss the store bought pods goodbye.  And they are messy to clean.  You can't beat the convenience of grabbing a pod, dropping it in, and a minute later having pretty good to darned good coffee without grinding and waiting for a pot to perk or pour over.
review_title: Works great, but you sure are paying for the convenience.  Pods have skyrocketed in price.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: posh
review_text: I love this little kureig. I thought it would be cumbersome to fill each time and it would heat up slow, but it doesn't. It's super fast. The coffee is hot but not too hot to drink. It shuts off itself. I purchased the pewter one it looks so sleek. I ordered reusable pods to better honor the environment. I am pleased with my purchase.
review_title: Great little kuruig for fresh cup anytime
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Lily R
review_text: I love my full-size Keurig, but needed a smaller single-serve pot to leave at my dad's house. This is it. On the down side, you can't leave it on to have the water hot and ready for a second cup. And It takes a lot longer for the co-op to brew than the full-size Kuerig. It's very short. Only a standard size coffee mug will fit with the drip pan in place. It removes easily, though for a taller mug. My 10 or 12 ounce tall cups barely fit, but the capacity is only 10 ounces anyway. Super tall travel mugs will not fit. You will have to use something else and then pour into the taller mug. It does have a nice long cord with built in cord storage for when the outlet is near the coffee maker. There is no filter on this pot, so I plan to only use bottled water in it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Cactuswren
review_text: I am not impressed with this brewer.  We had the first Kurig single cup brewer in our RV for 10-12 years and it was much better made and brewed better coffee. Unfortunately, it quit working.  We are very disappointed in this new one as it is mostly plastic and it doesn't make good coffee due to the water not  being hot enough and coming out too fast.
review_title: We had the first Kurig single cup brewer in our RV for 10-12 years and it was much better made and brewed better coffee
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: andrea mcclain
review_text: I hate it. The power button doesn't illuminate - can't tell if it is on or off. I've had it only 6 weeks and have used it only a handful of times and it appears to be dead. I know it has power because it is plugged into a power strip but there is no indication of power at the brewer. The way it fills and measures water added is also annoying, but I'd be happy if it just worked. At all.
review_title: I hate it. The power button doesn't illuminate - can't ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kubtrac
review_text: Complex sequence to brew, which results in short cups followed by overflows.  Is this the best that they can do in a compact k-cup brewer?  Keurig should be ashamed--oh, that's right, they don't care.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kim H.
review_text: I owned a keurig previously for about 8 years. I guess I assumed ones on the market now are an improvement but this is certainly not. It reminds me of a hotel coffee maker that s confusing, a huge mess, slow, and poorly designed. I can t believe this is still on the market. It doesn t fit any coffee cup and brews all the water you put in it, so it will overflow with boiling hot coffee if you put the tiniest bit too much in there (which is easy to do when you can t see if there s any water already in the machine). The drip tray never catches all the water it  conveniently  ejects with no warning, so don t have any water in there already. And don t remove it to fit your normal, human sized coffee mug or you ll have water rapidly shooting across your counter. This is a steaming pile of garbage! I m certainly not trusting reviews for coffee makers anymore after this. For $20 more you can get a keurig that isn t a total piece of junk.
review_title: Cheap, poorly designed hotel coffee maker
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Twinklestar
review_text: I bought this machine after both of my more deluxe Keurig coffeemakers broke in the same week.  Since the 2.0 model had given me so much grief, I decided that it was time to go back to simplicity ... their most basic machine.  It works well enough, but it is really, really slow.  I used to have an original Keurig like this one, and I just didn't remember it being this slow.  That said, it brews coffee, and that's what I need it to do.
review_title: I used to have an original Keurig like this one
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Anthea R. Close
review_text: I am so pleased to receive this lovely Keurig compact K-cup pod coffee. It is great for a cup of coffee when I feel like it there is no mess with using the lids and that is such a change from my normal percolator.  It looks so nice in my kitchen and the packaging was excellent so no breakages occurred.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: M. Dick
review_text: I am very pleased with the size since I have a small kitchen with very little counter space to spare.  I was however ready to return it because it was missing THE WATER LEVEL GUIDE that was drawn and mentioned in several places in the User Guide.  I called Keurig (very nice and helpful customer service) and found out that this new model no longer has this part.  Instead it had dots on the lid attachment to indicate water level for size cup you choose to make.  So, my only complaint is that they should make new user guides.  The missing part, that really wasn't missing, made me feel like I'd received a machine that had been returned.  So 4 stars.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Penny
review_text: This is the 3rd Keurig single serve coffee maker we have purchased in less than one year and each has crapped out.  We have cleared the clogged needle that punctures the pod, but that only causes the coffee maker to work for a few more cups, then it stops working.  The first two we bought, we thought maybe we just got a lemon.  But now the third has stopped working.
review_title: Keurig Single Serve coffee maker -- big waste of money as they don't last.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mike
review_text: Purchased the K15 August 30, 2017, and it has totally stopped working less than 2 months later.  The machine takes the water and then only drips of coffee come out, a fraction of the amount of water that went in.  I've had to turn the machine upside down to get the water out.  I purchased the same machine in December of 2016 for a different apartment and that one still works fine.  I use distilled water for both, as is recommended.  I'm going to try to send this back and get something else.
review_title: I purchased the same machine in December of 2016 for a different apartment and that one still works fine. I use distilled water for both
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: mary Boyle
review_text: I am very disappointed. I purchased this for my daughter for her college dorm and it only worked correctly for 2 months. She would pour the appropriate amount of water into the system and only half would return into the cup. The rest would leak.  She only informed me when she came home for Christmas break. I am very surprised. I have a larger one at home that works great. I wish keurig would stand behind their products and get rid of this model and reimburse us.  Since I purchased this model I've seen many of the same complaints.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Thinking Woman
review_text: My big Keurig broke. They do. I had purchased this model in jade (prettyj for my sister when she came home from rehab after breaking her leg. She likes things simple, and this looked easy to operate. It is. She loves it. Later that month when my Keurig broke, I decided to go for this one because I love its small footprint and splashy red color. It works fine, makes excellent coffee, is easy to operate. I have it on my counter next to the sink because it has no reservoir and must be filled for each cup. I kept the large one on the other end of the counter but always kept a pitcher of fresh water next to it to refill. I suppose you could do that if you have no space next to sink. If you use a taller mug, you will have to slide out the well under the spout, but that is no problem. I like this machine a lot.
review_title: and this looked easy to operate
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: carter
review_text: Pretty to look at.  I have yet to use it.  The last 3 I have had had to go back after like a couple of months as it would stop regulating the water properly.  i cleaned and did all tricks.  Issue they said was my well water.  I tried filtered and no diff.  I went to walmart and bought a little single cup one in their brand that is black and is the same style.  It was $19.99 and it has not given up on me yet.  A hell of a lot cheaper for sure.  So my last replacement one from Keurig is sitting on the shelve of my closet, unopened and will use if the walmart one does the same, but so far it has outlasted all of them.  Maybe I will use it as a gift to someone sometime.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Harold E. Schwartz
review_text: The first unit I purchased  lasted about a week before it was unable to brew a cup of coffee and only dripped coffee during the audible brewing cycle before shutting down and I was unable to restart. The defective unit was replaced by Amazon and the new unit made one cup before failing to make another. I returned it for a refund and wondered how Keurig could market this product. I did contact Keurig Customer Service and a very patient person walked me through a cleaning of the piercing needle with a paper clip procedure. We finally got the unit to work after a few tries. It failed again the next day. I am using Keurig Peets Coffee Pods. Keurig, "enough is enough" and I am back to my faithful Cuisinart 4 cup brewer.
review_title: The first unit I purchased lasted about a week before ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Easy to use. Makes coffee fast. We like this size coffee maker than the larger Keurig ... It takes up less counter space, add fresh water each time and 3 sizes to choose for your coffee. I got tired of the larger Keurig having to unplug the needles weekly. We cleaned per Keurig instructions but the larger Keurig would continually get plugged up either dribbling a few drops of coffee and stopping the process or not working at all. This smaller single serve Keurig is awesome ... So far ... and we hope to enjoy for a longer time than our larger one that we are now getting rid of. We most likely will purchase another one to use in our RV when we go camping.
review_title: AWESOME K15 Classic Single Serve Coffee Maker
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Vanessa
review_text: My husband and I have been on the fence for years about getting one of these single serve products.  My mother-in-law has this in her home and we really liked the fact that it was compact, simple & easy to use.  Makes up to a 10 oz drink.  You can remove the tray to put a slightly taller mug, but nothing tall like a travel mug (plus, you would need to make 2 separate servings to fill a travel mug).  Just pour what you make in a regular mug into a travel or taller mug.  There's no water storage container; you pour water before you make you coffee/tea.  Not a big deal for us and we like knowing we have fresh water with each serving.  BTW we have a regular full size coffee maker, but sometimes we only want one cup &/or something special (flavored coffee).  This Keurig is perfect just for that.  We've been using this for almost a month.  No problems at all.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: ZenDogs
review_text: Maybe I am out of touch as I am older than dirt (so my students tell me). I just expect things to last longer than a year. Not my vacuum cleaners. I admit, my vacuum cleaners have a Herculean task as I work in rescue and have anywhere from 1 to 20 dogs in the house. So I cut the vacuum cleaners some slack. But unless they were making coffee when I was gone, there is no excuse that I know of for something to last one year and then just plum quit. Doesn't even light up. I liked it when it worked. We have hard water and I took that into account but even with out water (and I cleaned if often) I don't know why it just died. I'm very disappointed.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Starlifter777
review_text: This Keurig K15 Single serve machine looks great, but is at the low end of a cheaply made product.  I was replacing my Keurig 15 year old single serve that finally was worn out.  What a surprise when this very disappointing Keurig product arrived.  The biggest disappointment, that ultimately led me to return it, was, the coffee just did not come out very hot.  I tried it a few times, asked other people's opinion, and they all agreed that the coffee came out warm, not hot.  Sure enough, other printed reviews reported the identical problems.  I do not recommend this product.
review_title: Keurig K15 coffee maker, does NOT make a hot cup of coffee.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: K. Hoskins
review_text: I bought mine in September 2016, and it worked great for 11 months. But about a month ago, it started leaving grounds in my coffee. I cleaned it out, but it kept happening. This morning, I filled the water, put my pod in, and hit "brew." It is running and making the brewing noise, but nothing comes out. I changed out the pods, but nothing is brewing. Very disappointed that it crapped out less than a year after purchase.
review_title: Quit working less than a year after purchase
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: How can I do it? Can I return it? When I add a cup of water to the machine, the machine only makes half cup of water to me. It doesn't work as usual.
review_title: How can I do it? Can I return it ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Paula Tamburro
review_text: Complete garbage.  I bought this on May 7, 2017. A little over 3 months. I make sure I cleaned it regularly with a Keurig descaler.  It is now leaking all over the place. All I ask for is a cup of coffee. What a total waste of money.  UPDATE. The day I wrote this review a representative from Keurig replied to my review. They gave me a number to call. I called that same day and spoke to a very helpful representative named Sandra. After a few questions on the situation and  giving her the serial number she offered to replace my coffee maker free of charge. They will send me a new one. She also requested I send back the old one can will send me a shipping label to this will also not cost me anything. I am a still a little upset with the coffee maker by I cannot say enough nice things about Keurig's customers service and their willingness to make things right.
review_title: Failed at 3 months - I have updated this review because of Keurig's excellent customer service
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: susie b.lem
review_text: Purchased this item because of its sleek small design and and 6-10 oz optional cup size. It was all I needed, and the lack of water reservoir was not an issue. The only problem is, there is no cup size option. I played around with it for about an hour trying to get it to give me a 10 oz cup of coffee and it never delivered, regardless of how many ounces of water is put in. If you run it through twice you can get 12 oz, if you run it once you get 6. I am returning this item, it s a 6 oz single cup maker. Get it together Keurig.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: MK
review_text: What a neat gadget.  I was a bit skeptical at first, because of several negative reviews, but since the positive reviews were in the majority I went ahead and took a chance.  So far, it works perfectly, exactly as described.  Amazingly simple and easy to use.  Very fast.  Coffee comes out nice and hot.  We have a large Bunn drip coffee maker which we use first thing in the morning when we both have a couple of cups, but for later in the day when I only want one cup, this is perfect.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Joe S
review_text: My Gen 1 B60 started malfunctioning a few months ago and I've been looking for a replacement. I his was the second B60 I've had fail in less th 5 years (this was the original unit's warranty replacement). I didn't want to spend more than $100 dollars on a Keurig when they fail outside of warranty. I like the flexibility of being able to use K-Cups as well as my own coffee.  This unit had fewer features but was in the price range I was after..
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Krista G.
review_text: Works great and I got it for a good deal. This is definitely a good size for a dorm with only 2 people that will be using it. Make sure you read the manual on the proper care for it, like always make sure to use bottled or filtered water in your Keurig.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: M Wilson
review_text: I typically never write negative reviews unless the product is defective.  I used this Keurig about 7 times and it stopped working.  It would not power on.  I watched all the problem-solving videos to no avail.  It was dead.  I have a modern kitchen with GFT outlets.  I had the product too long to return to Amazon. I contacted Keurig as it was still under warranty and they shipped me a newer model.  Don't waste your time with the K15 model.  I have two other Keurig products (home and office for over 5 years and they are still working perfectly.
review_title: Keurigs are good---but not this model.  Don't buy it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Susan Hinton
review_text: We've owned several Keurigs but this is my first single cup coffee maker. It was a little tricky to figure out how to make it brew but I finally got it. The measuring is a little hit and miss and you have to do everything in just the right order: 1) Turn on the machine, 2) Pour in the water, 3) Lift the lever and hold it until all the water is dispensed into the heat area, 4) Insert  your K cup, 5) Place your regular coffee cup on the holder (it won't hold tall or large cups), 6) Press the brew button. Once I got it, it works fine. I'm just grateful I have my K cup coffee at work!!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: R.M
review_text: I don't know why, but this Keurig did not heat up the water enough to brew the coffee. I tried three times with no luck. My in-laws have a bigger version and I am wondering if those are just better at heating the water up. I had to return this coffee maker. I guess I will just stick my old drip coffee pot.
review_title: Does not get water hot enough
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Carter
review_text: If you know the correct order of steps, this is fine. However, after about 6 months of use the water dispensing started acting up, so that some cups would be smaller than the water put in, and the next cup would be overflowing (presumably with the extra water from the previous cup). Unless you are REALLY tight on space, you're better off getting a Keurig with a water reservoir.
review_title: Works okay, but Keurigs with water reservoirs work better.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Treefarm Guy
review_text: I'm glad I got this compact Keurig.  I'm using it on a boat, so I don't have a lot of counter space.  This smaller unit fits nicely.  I'm liking everyting about the coffee maker, but for some reason, our unit was delivered without the water level indicator disks shown on line and in the manual.  You don't have to have the water level indicator to use the machine of course, but it would have been a nice convenience.  I checked the Keurig website, and I didn't find the water level insert sold separately.
review_title: Water Level Indicator Not Included with Shipment
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: We replaced a big Keurig that had a water tank on the outside with this single cup brewer.  We love it!  HOT coffee or tea in less than two minutes.  Quiet operation.  Always a clean cup of fresh water going in...no water sitting in the tank.  Great purchase!
review_title: We love it! HOT coffee or tea in less than ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mel
review_text: I really wanted a Keurig for afternoon cappucino and to have more variety for guests. I still use a traditional coffee maker for my daily cup of Gevalia espresso roast, so I didn't want to pay a lot for something that would be used maybe once a week. The mini fits this bill! I also like that you can fill your cup with the desired amount of water instead of trying to figure out what the buttons mean on the traditional Keurig models.
review_title: Great value for occasional Keurig user (or guests!)
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Michele
review_text: I think i need to return this item and get and new in return since every time I make a cup of kureg coffee it is NOT hot  I do not make keurig coffee often and when I read my status it states that July was the return deadline,,, I AM NOT HAPPY!!!!  I ordered it after my other keurig failed to dispel the water when I checked of course the warrenty is off so no help- I order this one and realize that it was not just a fluke thing that my coffee comes out semi warm--- NOT HOT and NO HELP,,,,,,  AGAIN  COME ON Keurig you need to replace this one I just bought a little over a month
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: TC
review_text: Love this!  Handy and quick.  We use the reusable filter as well as various flavor pods. Very satisfied.
review_title: Works great, with regular cleaning of needles
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: judy
review_text: this is the second Keurig I have ever had-the first lasted several years and gave great service as well. I wanted the smallest size because I am the only coffee drinker in my house and usually only have one cup a day. I had heard that machines with water reservoirs were prone to getting mold if the water was left in so this is just perfect. I make my single cup-there is no excess water. The coffee comes out hotter than in my previous model which I appreciate. It works very quickly-I put it on as soon as I get into the kitchen and the coffee is ready by the time I pour my cereal and juice.
review_title: Great if you don't have a lot of coffee drinkers in your household
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: PA
review_text: I've owned several Keurig coffee makers and really enjoyed them.  After some time, my first one lasted 5 years, it's time for a new one.  I wanted to downsize just to save some money and counter space so the compact was perfect.  It worked like a charm for about 3 months till one morning I made a cup and went back for another and NOTHING!!!  Did all the trouble shooting I could think of and then called Keurig.  They also tried some simple fixes and nothing.  Because it was less than a year old I was able to get an exchange.  Not only an exchange but they recommended an upgraded one.  Sure enough, today three days later my new one arrived.  Now all I have to do is set it up, put the broken one in the new box and ship it off.  So easy!!!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: BookCat
review_text: I like it, BUT, one month after receiving, part of the print on the two silver buttons was half gone, and by two months, there was no printing on the buttons at all.  Just seems very odd to me.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: It mostly makes only a half a cup, and it's not very hot when it brews. Often it overflows and leaks all over the counter. I've tried to deal with it, and I realize I'm past the return date, but it has been a most unsatisfactory product. I carefully make sure I put in the correct amount of water and still it doesn't make enough coffee. It certainly isn't cost efficient as it wastes a pod of the expensive coffee making only half a cup, and barely hot at that. Amazon has always made good my purchases, but this one has got to be a lemon and an exception to the quality that Keurig stands for. It isn't the first Keurig that I have had either, but the first single serve. I am very unhappy with this product.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: GK5040
review_text: Bought this small Keurig for our boat.  We have a full size one at home which I like much much better.  I feel like the K15 does not brew as hot a cup of coffee as the bigger units.  Its not as convenient to pour the water in the back of the unit, but we needed this compact design to fit the space.  However, its fine for a weekend here or there, but I wouldnt want it for everyday use. If you are someone who doesnt drink coffee very often, its probably fine.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Aulona
review_text: I got this for the office. It s a bit small and I doesn t fit the standard paper coffee cups, but they fit just fine after removing the bottom piece.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Ron R. Glaeseman
review_text: I found this single cup machine difficult to use. Since it has no water reservoir, you have to fill the machine each time you use it. In the top, there is a plastic do-dad that is supposed to tell you how much water to pour in for the size cup you want. I could never get it straight and would always add more water than necessary meaning that the cup overflowed. Would not buy again. PS- In reading the number of reviews on the product, I've decided that the fault must be with myself, dear Brutus. No one else seems to mention the measuring device in the reservoir. I gave it another star.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: L
review_text: Perfect single size. I like the fact that I don't have to clean out the water reservoir as often as I would on a larger unit as there is no standing water.  I did learn I could pour in a larger cup of water when I lifted the front piece to allow to the water to continue to flow into the unit. Since I use my cup to pour in the water, there is no overflow. Also, very quick heating process
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Morris & Andrea Hicks
review_text: I purchased one of these a few years ago then stopped drinking coffee for a while gave it away. Well that old one is still go strong. The new one I bought from Amazon ended up just like all of the other people who left negative reviews after prolonged use. Mine preformed okay for about three weeks. It never brewed a very strong cup though. After a month or two it was putting out such eeak coffee that my dark roast was common out of the machine so light that it didn't even look like coffee. It was more like the color watered down over tea. I was so drawn in by the price as my original one was over $100, I didn't pay much attention to reading individual reviews because it had a decent average. Anyways I ed ended up throwing this piece of junk away ave replaced it with a $21 machine that out performs this one by far. Don't waste your money!
review_title: Not made like they used to be!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: A Com
review_text: Too much effort to return, but within 1st month of low use started having the same problems other reported. Half of the time the cup just fails, water oozes over the kcup and doesn't go through. I've had 2 keurigs before and never had problems like this. It's garbage.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mikey
review_text: Loved the concept. Compact design fits perfect in our RV. The big problem is everything we brew has a plastic taste and odor.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Wayne P. Swenson
review_text: Purchased as a Christmas gift for my son. He said it worked for about 6 weeks before it started leaking, then quit altogether. He didn't tell me so I wouldn't feel bad. As soon as I knew, I tried to get it replaced. I didn't realize the return policy was so restrictive. The return window had closed on 1/31/18 and the product support window closed on 2/21/18. Can't say that's really backing your product. I'd always heard good things about Keurig but doubt I'll buy another. Turns out I'm not the only one who had problems with this model. Always read the reviews. And also, as always, Amazon is my go to place to shop.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I really loved this, but I've had it for a little over 6 months now and it just stopped working. I am the only coffee drinker in my house, and this machine was probably used max 4 times a week. So, now it's broken and can't be returned. Maybe the larger models are more reliable, but if you're a heavy coffee drinker, I wouldn't get this little model that couldn't handle my modest coffee habit.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: abc
review_text: The product itself is average - 3 stars:
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Lisa P
review_text: We own a larger Keurig and love it.  We thought this one would be perfect for our vacation home.  We were so very wrong.  It is constructed of very cheap plastic and the handle felt like it was going to break every time it was lifted and pulled down.  Worse, it took longer to heat the water for a single cup of coffee than anyone should expect, much longer than it takes for our larger Keurig.  If I didn't know it, I'd think this was a knockoff sold at a discount chain rather than a licensed Keurig product.  After using it for 3 days we returned it to Amazon and purchased the larger Keurig version we found  on sale at a different retailer.  The difference in price is worth it for a product we use every day.
review_title: We own a larger Keurig and love it. We thought this one would be perfect ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Genevieve Schmid
review_text: It is a beautiful color, but that is about all that it is.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mz.Envy
review_text: I kind of do not understand how this works. I thought that I needed filters or something so I went on to purchase some just to find out that they do not fit. They kpod holder is really hard to take a part. I haven't used the machine yet but I wanted to test it for cleaning purposes for my mom. Once I knew it all, I was going to teach her. Guess I'll go to YouTube to find out more details eventually.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Wendy
review_text: We bought this coffeemaker for my memory-impaired mother-in-law, who now lives with us. I finally got tired of her making a full pot of coffee every morning and forgetting to ever drink it. Much less waste this way, and NO clean-up.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kgog
review_text: I wanted a coffee pot that would make 1 cup for me each morning and no more.  I liked the small size and the ease of the product until it stopped working.  It started having problems after just 2 months.  It would fill with water and then not release the water.  I would run vinegar through it several times.  My husband would try to clean it.  At first we thought it was getting clogged by a coffee ground.  This happened a few times a month for several months months.  Now it won't even get power.  We have no clue why this happened.  It was used once daily and that's it.  I'm afraid to buy another.
review_title: It lasted only a few months
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Stuna
review_text: Bought this as a travel coffee maker. Might have been OK for just one person, but for a group, it takes waay to long (when it works) - for more than one person, get a unit with a water tank. This system has a top tank, when ya our water, then a heating tank the water drains into when you load a cup, and an excess tray under the cup, where half the water goes for one reason or another.. Why they designed it this way, instead of a simple turn it on and it boils what's in the tank" system is unknown... Now you can't see how much water is ready.. Also, as the thing doesn't work75% of the time, you have water everywhere, 1st tank, second tank, overflow, countertop.... Not sure how many times I tried ton brew a cup and got like 5 drops of coffee for my efforts. Seemed to only work after a power cycle. Very very poorly engineered device, could have been a very very simple and robust system, but they tried to get tricky and, well, they pooched it. Does anyone else other than Keurig make kcup nakechines? This is the 3rd Keurig mchine I've owned that has come as crap from factory, or quickly turned to crap....
review_title: Takes forever, doesn't work well, over engineered for what it needs to do
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Brian S.H.
review_text: Great coffee maker until it breaks. We have had really bad luck with Keurig coffee makers this being our third in two years that has died essentially within less than 6 months of purchasing it. We love the coffee maker and how small and simple it is, but at the cost for it to only last 3 months on this one I would not purchase another. We even followed all cleaning instructions. We purchased this end of  May 2017 and as I write this on September 7th, it is broken and will not work. Bad news for a parent of two kids under two!!!!
review_title: Great little coffee maker too bad it only lasted 3 months.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Sandra L. Larsen
review_text: Earlier malfunction - Amazon with usual quality customer satisfaction, replaced. Received last night - enjoyed HOT! cuppa coffee this morning made with my Keurig/K-cup/red pepper colored appliance...better than before!  Would highly recommend Amazon sensitivity to customer - Amazon.com friend to buyer objective to provide fulfillment of my wishes, need, expectations - especially as disabled, without transportation, senior!  Thank you Amazon.com team!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Holly C.
review_text: Works great! You do have to fill the water resevoir for each cup, each time you make it. Not a big deal, but an extra step compared to ones that allow you to fill the tank for several cups at a time. Fits standard mug and removing the tray at the bottom gives you a little extra room for a larger cup if needed. I'm a coffee snob and this makes a decent cup!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: J. Beard
review_text: I got this for a small-space application, and it's perfect.
review_title: and it's perfect. It does not store any water
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Susan Handgen
review_text: I purchased this Keurig in January, it's August and I just threw it in the trash! It just died...no reason, just won't turn on. I'm furious that something so simple and basic cost so much. I expected more. I had a full sized Keurig for a couple years before this purchasing this one, it started to malfunction. I'm done with Keurig, they cost too much and definitely do way too little! Back to my tried and true Cuisinart, thank God I kept it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Elinore Olsen
review_text: I bought this because it's healthier: can use fresh coffee; water always fresh. Seems to be working out fine. Doesn't take up so much room either.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Crestwood
review_text: I loved my first Keurig that I bought several years ago (& still use daily) enough to buy a second one for my office. The one for work lasted about a year and a half, which was disappointing. I thought that I might have gotten a  lemon,  so I ordered this one again. Big mistake. It did not work properly straight out of the box. About a tablespoon of coffee came out in the first cup. I took the k-cup out and rotated it a quarter turn (puncturing a second hole in the bottom, and, voila...I got the rest of my coffee. On the second cup, I repeated. Same results, same fix. On the third cup, no luck. At that point I boxed it up & sent it back & purchased a more expensive model. I did notice that the one I received yesterday had been  cheapend  in quality: the cord had been shortened, the k-cup holder was changed, and the reservoir no longer had indicators for beverage volume (i.e. 6 oz, 8oz, 10oz). Do yourself a favor and don t buy this particular model.
review_title: Was a great product - not anymore.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Donna C.
review_text: I love the compact size and cheerful red color for my kitchen and believe the only down side is having to use purified water rather than my hard tap water along with no reservoir...but pleased overall with my purchase as I'm enjoying the Keurig experience!
review_title: Overall I'm enjoying the Keurig experience
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: AuntGranny
review_text: Love our Keurig @ home & ordered this unit to use in our RV.  After almost 2 wks. of use, we are happy with it.  Another reviewer mentioned a chemical taste & returned the unit.  Before use, I ran water through it @ least 3-4 times & I didn't think the coffee tasted real good the 1st few days I brewed coffee.  Even thought about returning it but the next day, the coffee turned out good.  As others reviewers have said, I'm hoping it doesn't break as there are a lot of poor reviews.
review_title: Happy with K15 so far - hope it doesn't break!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mrs. TR
review_text: Delivered without the water level indicator disks shown online. Also delivered without the manual. It appears to be a used machine. The original seal of the box was broken. There was no protective cover on the unit and it was collecting dust and has scratches. There was no protective tape or anything. All clear signs this is NOT a new machine. Being returned ASAP.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Beatrice Thompson
review_text: If you camp with a trailer set up with a rear galley, this little coffee machine may come in handy. I have to turn it sideways when shutting the galley door, but it fits that way fine. I use a refillable K-Cup device to avoid putting more waste in the campground trash.
review_title: Great Little Coffeemaker For Camper Trailers
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kaye T Harris
review_text: Ok, I waited a bit before leaving this review.  I had read reviews and was worried about a few things but it turns out (IMHO) some of the "problems" are from people NOT following directions.  First I ordered the Keurig that I thought would work best for ME.  I did not want a reservoir as I only usually drink one cup a day so I got the smallest one.  I'm LOVING it!  Used to just drink my instant.  Now its like I get a Coffee House experience daily but even better I can just heat the water in the Keurig for my instant too if I've run out of K-cups.  I've had a blast trying different coffees and a few teas and am saving the hot chocolates for winter:)  So - no problems here but I do have some suggestions.  If you don't want the needle to get gummed up DON'T  leave the used Kcup in it for grounds to dry out in it.  Dispose immediately after making.  I'd suggest just using it to heat water on a regular basis too.  Next - there is a certain order to how this unit MUST be operated.  First pick out your coffee,  then measure water for cup (must be LESS than the gauges in top or water WILL run over into bottom)  pour into top.  Turn unit ON.  Lift section where pod goes - this allows water to run into heating chamber- be sure to wait til all has run down.  Put in pod, close and press the flashing blue button.  My coffee has always been more than hot enough.  Remove used pod (careful - hot!) and toss)  If you follow this you should be trouble free and enjoy your coffee.  So far my best Coffee has been from the "Real Good Coffee" company.  Love my Keurig, feel so special each morning now - and I don't pay Starbucks for it!  I also got the Keurig rolling tray to keep my pods in and the maker goes on top with my sugar containers.  Rolls back each morning!
review_title: First I ordered the Keurig that I thought would work best for ME
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Meh!  It's o.k., I don't know if Keurig changed their machine or pods or both. But the coffee is not as good as it once was.  I was so annoyed that I opened up a new pod to discover what looks like a new filter media.  The older ones used a paper or paper-like filter and this new one looks like it may be plastic and would explain the flavor change.  Back in my pre-Keurig days I could tell a definite difference between paper filters and metallic filters, I preferred the paper hands-down.
review_title: No What It Used To Be
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: NEB
review_text: I ordered this for my vacation house and have had nothing but trouble with it. (I have tried to use it a total of 4 months)  The spout gets clogged and it will not make coffee.  I have used official Keurig K cups,  filtered water for purity, have cleaned it several times with the suggested cleaner, have use white vinegar to clean it ,as found online used a straightened paperclip to clear the small holes that dispense water and have communicated with Keurig.  NOTHING has made this a permanent fix.  I have a black one at home that I have had never had any problems with--after many years...I am going to try to get a refund
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: madcarlotta
review_text: I had an inexpensive Mr Coffee brand K cup coffee maker that worked beautifully for about 10 years. It finally stopped brewing on a consistent basis so I bought this model to replace my old one. Right out of the box, after I brewed 2-3 cups of coffee, this maker stopped working. It would brew maybe 1" of disgusting, gritty coffee concentrate if it brewed at all. It seemed as if there was a problem with how the water would drop down into the chamber after pouring it in and pulling the lever. I promptly returned that machine and Amazon kindly sent me a replacement machine of the same model. That one worked for about 3 weeks and then it did the exact same thing! I started looking at more of the reviews here and I cannot believe how many consumers had the same problem I've had with this terrible piece of junk machine! I wish I had realized this before I bought this thing. If you're considering this machine please heed my warning and that of others here. I'm glad this replacement machine pooped out when it did so I can send it back - and I'm glad I saved the packaging, twice! But do I love having to go without coffee while I deal w/ replacing this machine twice? No. Do I love repackaging this piece of garbage - twice? No. Do I love hauling this heavy box back to the UPS store twice? Not at all. I'm a busy mom and each time I do this I've got a fussy toddler in tow needing to be strapped in and out of her car seat repeatedly. And doing this and dealing with her without coffee is just cruel! I don't know how Keurig gets away w/ selling something so shoddily made that a full 1/4 to 1/3 of people are having it break, not work, or not brew properly. It's junk! My old $50 Mr Coffee K Cup maker lasted nearly 10 years with no problems and I've also had a Nespresso machine just as long and it's so sturdy I swear it's perfect despite the fact I've only descaled it once in a decade! It could be thrown out of a high rise window and survive while this machine doesn't work after 2-3 brews. I'm done w/ this model and Keurig as a brand. Shame on them!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: SCPOret
review_text: I like the coffee maker - it works fine and I can buy the Folgers K-cups at my local grocer.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Sandiacindy
review_text: After using this for a couple of weeks, it began to brew just two ounces at a time. I contacted Keurig and was told to clean the needle. I also had to switch to purchased bottled water - my filtered water didn't work. Machine brewed two cups and then the same issue started. I cleaned the needle, but the performance is still impaired. I am returning this item. Cleaning the needle is challenging. Keurig has a video on their website but I couldn't get it to load after three attempts. I believe they should include instructions for cleaning the needle with the product and clearly state upfront about the special water required.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Doug McLaskey
review_text: It would have been great to have a brew option as do the larger Keurigs.  But other than that, this is a GREAT little brewer for travel and fitting on an already crowded countertop.

review_title: Used right out of the box after delivery

review_text: My husband bought a single cup Keurig used at a local Goodwill, and it worked great for nearly two years. When it finally died, I purchased this one. name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Received this  Item around  June 9 and I used approximately four times a week .  On July 23 it did not work as it was burned out life expectancy on this item  is approximately six weeks .  I never moved the item it only sat on my kitchen counter . It was a cheap product and you get what you pay for. They then replaced it on July 27th for no charge which was great, however I was out of town for the month of August and only used September about 25 times and 2 days ago October 5th itdid not work. The life expectancy is extremely short.

review_text: I don't know if I've just gotten devices from a bad lot but 2 of the exact same keurigs have had the same issue. The water stops traveling from the well to actually brew the coffee.
