name: Claudette
review_text: This item was a terrible find. The first time I used this Keurig it BLEW UP! It all but caught on fire. I went exactly by the instructions. When it was time to brew the k cup the cup blew apart and melted as the heating unit began smoking. I do not recommend this Keurig. I bought it for my daughter going to college. Glad we tried it out before this happened in her room! I had to rate with a star or I couldn't post but I would not give this item any stars!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Dr. Denny
review_text: Love it! We have a regular size but this one fits in the luggage and we take it with us when we travel-to have our Death Wish Coffee Keurig cups. Could not be more pleased! Alternatively, we have a guesthouse and this allows our guests to make their coffee upon waking.
review_title: Great travel Keiurgi or for guests in the guest house
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Cynthia Martz
review_text: This is a True Blue,like a great friend,I can not do without.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Ars Arcanum
review_text: This is perfect if you are a one cup and done coffee drinker. The compact size is great for limited counter space areas like an apartment or college dorm. I've been using it for eight months so far and it works great. It also works with the Keurig My K-Cup Reusable Ground Coffee Filter. It really is designed for light coffee drinking though. If you like multiple cups then you shell out a few extra dollars for a model with a water container - as filling up the water canister with each new cup can get pretty tedious.
review_title: Great for single serve coffee, and only single serve coffee.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Alexandria N.
review_text: After one month of using this coffee maker it would become clogged after every single cup. I followed all the directions for unclogging it and when I went to use Keurig descaling cleaner it just stopped working. So basically I have a non-working machine. I'm not happy
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

review_text: Lasted about 6 weeks before it quit drawing in water from the reservoir.  When I contacted Keurig the response was a link to their troubleshooting pages.  Nothing specific to my problem.  Nothing but an automated response.
review_title: Lasted about 6 weeks before it quit drawing in water ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Greg White
review_text: Updated 2/21/18
review_title: Definitely Designed By An Engineer and Not A User
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Linda Huffman
review_text: I received my Keurig on January 16th of this year.  My last date for return was February 15th. I loved my Keurig and used it frequently with no problems. On Friday, March 9th, it quit working.  The lights go on and it sounds like it's brewing, but nothing comes out.  This was my second Keurig (the first bought from Sam's Club) and neither one has been satisfactory. Now I have all these k-cups and no use for them.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: dingbat51
review_text: Already had a Keurig and bought this one for my wife.  I like the fact you can brew just one cup as opposed to a full pot, but the K-cups are expensive.  Do yourself a favor and purchase the adapter that lets you use regular ground coffee.  The adapter will pay for itself in less than one 3-pound can of coffee.
review_title: I like the fact you can brew just one cup as ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I have two of these units in less than a month and both of them just stopped pumping the water into the cup. One made 3 cups of coffee the other maybe 10. I am most disappointed in the customer service that was never extended. When I asked if I was doing something wrong or if they would recommend a different unit NO ONE responded!! Oh I got a shipping label to send the unit back but now I have no coffee machine, No thanks to Keurig.
review_title: I am most disappointed in the customer service that was never extended

name: Beachbaby
review_text: Although made out of plastic, it is pretty.  However, does not work for even a standard size mug.  You have to remove drip tray and put your mug on counter.  I don't know how well it works as I didn't try it, just the fact that it didn't take a standard size mug was enough for me to return it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mary G.
review_text: I bought this for my camper and unfortunately didn't test it out. Took it out 2 months later on a camping trip and it didn't work! I have a full size Keurig at home that works fine but this small K15 is a real disappointment and waste of money.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Nancy E Farris
review_text: This is the simplest Keurig design, which makes it my favorite. I don't need a reservoir, I don't need a pre-heater, I don't need another clock in my kitchen...I just need a cup of coffee. This is actually our second unit like this. We have a K10 at home and the new K15 at my work apartment.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: George
review_text: I'm not sure what Keurig was thinking with the dimensions of this unit. This isn't some bizarrre criticism of someone trying to stuff a 20oz mug into a Keurig that can only dispense up to 10oz. My normal 8-10oz coffee cups will not fit the K15 without removing the drip tray, which basically means there will be no circumstance where I could use this unit WITH the drip tray, which would almost certainly mean a constant mess. My 16oz Thermos won't fit this unit at all, even with the drip tray removed. I was planning to dispense two 6oz servings into my 16oz Thermos for taking on the go.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: A Customer
review_text: Bought a Chulux. Love it. Works fabulously. Less expensive and much better more straightforward mechanics. Only the Chulux does not come in the color I want. I bought this Keurig, love the color, but the machine broke in less than two months. Nothing I did seemed to fix it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: ABK
review_text: I purchased this Keurig on Oct 12,2017..It is already having problems...Half the water is not coming thru. Coffee is luke warm. My previous coffee pot was identical bought in 2013...it was used daily...never a problem...that's why I bought the same brand. The knew one is horrible.
review_title: Two months old & it is dying!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

review_text: I'm trying to figure out how to return this as it completely died two weeks ago. I did all the trouble shooting that comes with the machine. There is absolutely no power when it is plugged in to a live outlet.

review_text: Use it in our office.  Could be faster.  It only takes very short cups, so we had to take out the bottom when we bought the wrong size disposable cup.  Single serve is better than a reservoir for an office because nobody refills those when they empty them.

name: George Garris
review_text: Product worked very well for 14 months.  We used it twice a day for afternoon coffee.  Than it would only give us a 1/2 cup of very strong coffee.  We had to toss it.  Coffee makers should last for more than 500 cups of coffee.[[ASIN:B018UQ56IG Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black.  Brought a replacement on 7/17/2016.  I was lucky 2nd Keurig lasted 22 months.  When will Keurig make a coffee maker that will last two years?
review_title: Great Product which does not last

name: NRAMember
review_text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my wife. She is the only person in the house who drinks coffee and I scored some major brownie points with this gift. Perfect size for her needs. Takes up very little room on the counter and the black compliments all the other black appliances we own.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Skate Diva
review_text: I don't really understand the appeal of the Keurig system.  I bought this for my kid to use in her dorm room, and she eventually went back to buying coffee on campus.  We brought it home and I wanted to try it out.  It has three options: 6 oz. (weak), 8 oz. (weaker), and 10 oz. (weakest), because the only thing you can adjust is the amount of water.  I don't use the "pods" because of their cost and their effect on the environment, and the reusable filters only take 2 Tb. of coffee, so there seems to be no way to have a "robust" cup.  Some people suggest putting the same pod through twice - but then you've got 12 oz. of coffee when you only wanted a cup, so you have to spill off the rest, plus the extra time it takes to brew two cups ... might as well just stick to the pour-over method, where you can control the amount of coffee and water, the temperature of the water, and the speed at which you pour it over.  In my opinion.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: David Scott
review_text: Best purchase I ever made! I love it! In fact, I can't imagine how I ever got along without it in, you know, the Before Time. I don't even want to think about it. Those were dark, dire, grim days -- best left forgotten.
review_title: How did I ever live without this?
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

review_text: IT works well but my 89 year old mother is still confused by opening the top and having to allow the water to run down before closing.  Might have been better to get a traitional one with water reservoir for her.

review_text: When I received this product in late October 2017 I was very pleased.  Seemed to be perfect for me.  Until yesterday, Feb 28, 2018, when it simply refused to power on.  I did go through all the steps for Troubleshooting and I have followed instructions impeccably.  4 mos use from any appliance is very annoying.  From an appliance with a supposedly good reputation is unacceptable.  From what I have read, this is not an uncommon problem.  Wish I had known that before I was in position to have to deal with Warranty.
review_title: 4 mos after purchase it refuses to turn on.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Andrew G.
review_text: What an absolute piece of garbage. This is the worst Keurig I have ever used. I pour 10 ounces of water in and in return I get 3-4 ounces of coffee in my cup. Lift up the water lid and there s still 6 ounces of water sitting in the reservoir and the coffee machine will not work until you add more water. I m not even getting a replacement, I m going back to the $10 coffee pots. At least I know those will make me a cup of coffee when I want one.

review_text: Great one cup keurig. If you over fill it has a water tray to catch the excess. I would highly recommend this. Doesn't take up much room in my small kitchen.

review_text: We have 2 regular size Keurig and love them, however this model falls short of producing a satisfying beverage.  The unit does not produce water hot enough to qualify as hot coffee, more like warm.  It wasn't warm enough to melt powdered creamer.  Very disappointed.  We returned it immediatelh.

review_text: Within 8 weeks, the heating element began to go out. I called the company and they are sending me an upgrade free.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

review_text: I've had other Keurigs and they worked just fine and saw this small one perfect for my desk at work but broke after just 5 cups. review_text: Very unhappy I bought this. Inconsistent in the brewing.. sometimes it will work fine, next time will only dispense 1/2 of the water you pour in. You have to brew it twice to get the full amount. I use distilled water and am careful to put in the amount requested, follow instructions exactly. Just doesn t work well. And I don t like the taste of the coffee, which is also inconsistent in taste. Money wasted, time wasted.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

review_text: We have a commercial Keurig but this design is simple and works very well.  We take it in the car on road trips.  If you forget to put the cup on the fill spot, the tray will hold the entire cup of coffee thus no mess on the counter.  We like this one.

review_text: This is a wonderful product---if it would only work longer than three months. Clogs up twice in three days, after having to search internet for a solution. You have to get inside and clear out tubes with a paper clip. After the first time of going through this procedure it put out a couple of cups, then now it is stopped up again. Unless I happened to get a fluke, I would not necessarily recommend this product.  The name says it all---and maybe it really does!  Will look elsewhere for a better product and not depend on name brand---my mistake.

review_text: The size is perfect for our RV, but the operation is not intuitive. Otherwise, you will get less than a full cup and the reservoir on the top will still have the water when the brew is complete. Once we figured that part out, it was fine.

I am terribly disappointed in this product.  $50.00 is a lot to pay for something that only works three months.

name: Techy Gal
review_text: I had a Keurig that only worked when it wanted to.  I looked online and found that if you punched on the machine above the water lines it would brew and that "fix" worked a couple of times but then I got tired of having to spend 30+ minutes trying to get it to brew coffee.  I donated that machine and bought a Hamilton Beach 49981A Single Serve Scoop Coffee Maker which has worked beautifully for almost 5 years.  The only thing is that you have to clean it after every use.  I thought that Keurig had fixed the issues with their machines by now so I took the plunge in May and bought one for the convenience of having disposable pods.  Boy was I wrong.  I bought it in May but didn't actually start using it until July.  All I can say is that Keurig disappoints again.  For the past week, the machine now will only brew half a cup of coffee.  And then when it feels like it, it will use up all of the water that it hasn't used for the previous cups into one so you better be ready with another cup so you don't have a hot mess in your hands.  Needless to say I'm not even going to donate that machine.  I'm going to throw it in the trash.  You could not pay me enough money to buy a Keurig machine.  Lesson learned.
review_title: Keurig continues to make crappy machines.  Don't Buy!!!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Easy to use, compact and stylish. I love that I can make a variety of drinks, not just coffee. In glad I made this purchase. This keurig is easy, three step process and you have a hot drink. So simple my 9 year old can use it.

So if your coffee begins to taste "off" you will need to clean it, even though it may not have been that long since it was last cleaned.  Otherwise, as convenient as the earlier version.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

Yes I cleaned it, thinking it was scaled up - problem did not go away.  I would not recommend this product and do not plan on purchasing another to replace it.  I have a larger Keurig at home and have used Keurig at home for about 2 years.  I will look at other brands before I make a single cup purchase again.
review_title: Failed after 2 months and less than 20 cups of coffee -AVOID

review_text: This thing has a bit of a learning curve - with its simplicity (no reservoir) you'd think it'd be easy, but please note: the "brew" button turns RED when it's BREWING. But once you figure out that your coffee is actually brewing, and you did not, in fact, break the coffee machine before you even properly used it, you will love it :)

name: JessDoo
review_text: I absolutely love this little coffee maker. It doesn't hold any water, you just fill up your coffee mug with however much you want (this is how you make it stronger/lighter), and dump it in. You hit the flashing button, and boom, fresh coffee is pouring in about 1 minute. My husband and I use this daily, and we love that you can just make 1 cup at a time. It only takes a second to make another cup, so we don't mind just adding water each time we use it. It's small, quick, efficient, and makes a darn good cup of joe. I would recommend this to anyone that wants something simple, and isn't too picky about having multiple coffee options. I have no problem using my larger mugs, you just slide the base out and you can fit a really big mug in there. If you have a tall thermos, you can sort of cram it in there and lean it sideways, and it will work just fine (or fill up a mug and pour it into the thermos from there). Works great, especially for the price.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kenneth Sandberg
review_text: This is a good product, my second one of same sort.  The problem, and the reason I only gave it 3 stars, is it will clog up where the unit goes through the coffee pod after a while.  It really needs to be slightly redesigned so you can clean the little tube and dispenser unit much easier.  When I see it is starting to clog,  I run plain water through it a few times now and dislodge the small coffee particles that have begun to clog it. (They say to run vinegar through it periodically to remove water problems--and I do that also).  There is a youtube video showing you how to unclog it with a paper clip, but this is only a temp fix.  Real fix involves removing tiny screws and cleaning tube, and then putting on a new tube tighter to keep it not leaking.  If you are mechanical, no problem, if not, unit may become unusable if it really gets clogged up.  I threw my first one away because I thought the unit had gone bad.  No, it was just clogged
review_title: Good product with one major shortcoming
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

review_text: Bought this coffee maker as it was small and my wife loved the color.  We also have the K2 at work and it has never failed us.  The K15 is an inferior product.  As usual after the return date expired we started having trouble.  It has a simple design: Turn on, fill with water, place K cup in slot, and brew.  However this model does not heat up or poor water.  Unplug and re-plug, three or four times and sometimes it would work.  Now, it sounds like it is heating and about a 1/3 cup of water trickles out and it shuts off.  I've tried to unclog the machine, but still does not work.  Save yourself some hassle and just buy the K2.

name: 1wildflwr
review_text: I am so happy with this purchase! I am on a fixed income and only receive disability so an expensive coffee maker is a silly purchase. On paper. In real life it's soooo worth it! I can now have the cappuccinos that I have been craving for years but couldn't get to the gas station to taste. It's sooo easy to use and i'm beyond pleased that a standard tumbler will actually fit under here (if you pull out the catch tray. it's really easy to do, it just slides out). I have used my turvis tumblers both the talls and the squat ones and am so beyond pleased. The footprint is less than my toaster which is great because I live in an RV...tiny home living to the extreme. I can't tell you how wonderful it feels to lay in my clawfoot tub, watching TV and sipping a cup of white chocolate cappuccino or a tall glass of iced caramel machiato. This luxury item will pay for itself by the end of the month. i've had it two days and i've already drank four novelty drinks and one spiked pumpkin latte. omg. so good. I love that you can use an off brand single serve filter and your own coffee grounds too if you are so inclined
review_title: A lot of luxury in a small footprint & it fits full sized Turvis Tumblers too!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: The Lucianos
review_text: It's convenient. My only issue is it's not really built so that you can clean the areas very well where the water and coffee pods go, which Keruigs harbor a lot of bacteria so i'm very anal about keeping it clean so mold doesn't form. You can only fit a certain size mug underneath which is a bummer because I like to use travel mugs so I have to pour my coffee from a coffee mug into my travel mug. I personally like that you have to put the water in every time you want to use it, the ones with storage for water can get dirty and the water sits ....I put hot water in it every time so it doesn't have to heat up. I think this Keruig is good for a single person, who drinks maybe one or two cups at most a day. If you like to drink all different sizes 6,8,10 oz and or several cups a day I would go with the more expensive Keruig that stores the water and you can press a button to choose the size of the coffee instead of measuring out the oz of water you want to have in the cup you're about to make.

name: castlerobber
review_text: This is a nice little Keurig for making a cup or two of a hot beverage occasionally. I brew a full pot of coffee in my regular 10-cup coffeepot every morning; but the K15 is great for a single cup of decaf or flavored coffee at night, or for heating water for a cup of tea. It took me a minute to figure out the water-level indicator, even with the manual's help. I like the ability to add a little more or less water (within the 6- to 10-ounce range) to adjust the brew strength, instead of being locked into preset 6-, 8-, and 10-ounce cup sizes. The K15 will only fit a cup/mug up to 5.25" tall with the drip tray removed.
review_title: It it what it is, and that's all
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Nancy W.
review_text: I have to say I do love this product, but don't  you just love buying something that breaks down after just 2 months? My first one lasted -  wow - an entire YEAR.  Oh joy.  Why did I get another one, you ask?  I am a stumbling zombie in the morning before that morning cup of coffee goes down. K Cups are not very environmentally friendly, I know, (guilt, guilt)  but they are incredibly quick and easy for a single and zombiesque person not to waste making a whole pot. So imagine my dismay stumbling into the kitchen to have it go completely defunct after just 2 month's minimal use. O.K. They don't make appliances to last anymore, which is why I broke down and bought the 2nd one after only a year with the first one, but COME ON!!!! This is just CRUEL AND UNUSUAL TREATMENT!!! I am a teacher and need to be up and out the door quickly in the morning, and somewhat conscious when I start my work day. So if you really want it, and I would understand why, definitely get the insurance. You'll need it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Armand Jalbert
review_text: My old multi-cup Keurig was getting more and more clogged up no matter how many times I tried to clean it. I decided to try this single cup coffee maker and it is great. It takes longer to heat up the water. I pour the amount of water I want to heat but up to their limit. I put the k-cup into the machine and it takes about 3 minutes for the coffee to be ready. The big machine heats water that is in the tank so it's faster. This machine doesn't have a storage tank and uses only the water you immediately want to use. I feel that is healthier because I could not give my big coffee maker the cleaning it needed. This is small enough to bring with me when traveling and we have used it to make hot water for tea and hot chocolate with no coffee residual taste. It took a few uses to get the hang of using this more quickly.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: paperbackvacation
review_text: My husband is an occasional coffee drinker, while I drink none at all. I bought this for him for those times when he needs that extra pick-me-up, and for times when we have visiting coffee-drinking guests. While it s great for a family who uses a coffee maker rarely, there is one thing that I was incredibly disappointed with. Apparently this model used to have a water level indicator, now it no longer comes with that part. The directions manual even tells you how to use this feature, but after contacting customer service, they enlightened me to the fact that the company no longer includes it. I was instructed to simply fill a coffee mug with how much water I would need, then pour the water into the machine. Well, this process only ensures that 85% of the water gets in the machine while the rest spills all over the place (because let s face it, coffee mugs were made for drinking, not for pouring). Would have returned this for a different model had it not been such a pain to do so. I suggest avoiding this model and seriously investigating others.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Bought this for single-cup convenience, but this is seriously the worst, most inconvenient coffee maker I've ever seen. There is no function to control the cup size that you want brewed other than how much water you add - but if you add up to the large-mug-worth line, only about half of it makes it through to your cup in one brew so you'll have to restart it. But, now the machine says it needs more water added to the reservoir before it can brew another cup, so you'll have to do that first - you can't fool it by just opening and closing the reservoir lid. Then when you hit brew again, miraculously, the machine will produce both the half-mug you just added, *plus* the other half that disappeared the first time, meaning your s*** overflows everywhere.  This is not operator error - we've completely cleared the machine of water and started fresh and the same bulls*** happens no matter what. Also I've had this for literally about 2 months and used maybe 2 or 3 times a week (due to how generally obnoxious dealing with it is), and the type on the silver "Brew" button is already half worn off. So now - bonus! - it not only functions like s***, but looks cheap too. Get it if you love to be infuriated first-thing in the morning!
review_title: Shockingly bad product for the Keurig brand
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Clif
review_text: I rarely, if ever, review items on Amazon but I'm making an exception for the Keurig K15.  It worked for 42 days (and around 30 cups) and then started pumping water through the grounds too early resulting in weak, lukewarm coffee.  Instead of taking 2 minutes for the water to heat up (which the manual says is the approximate time and how it worked at first), the machine started pumping water in 30 seconds.  The resulting coffee was 140 degrees, measured using a thermometer I use when steaming milk with my espresso machine.  Fortunately, Amazon made an exception to the 30 day rule and allowed me to return the item for a refund.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

review_text: I have loved every Keurig I have had, except this one!!!  I bought this for my camper since it was small.  And I was on a trip, and it stopped working in the first 30 days.  But I wasn't at home where the box to return it was.  And when I tried to create a return via Amazon, I was outside the date by 4 days.  So I'm stuck.  Out $67 bucks.  I'll try and call someone.  I'm not going to re-order this.  I will try the K250 if the dimensions fit my camper.  If not, I'll find a Mr. Coffee or something.  And I was so proud of Keurig standing up to Hannity.  But product quality trumps (so to speak) politics.  DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT MODEL, YOU WILL BE SORRY.

review_text: I've wanted a single-serve for years for coffee-drinking guests but never wanted to spend the $$$. My husband hated coffee when we first started dating, and I didn't really drink it until I started my current job. In August we had a very large yard sale, which required tons of coffee due to how early those crazy people start. Our friend brought his over along with some Death Wish Coffee K-cups, and we had to get one for ourselves. Yes the price is high for something that we won't be using heavily, but it's perfect for us and we don't even mind the counter space it takes up.

name: K_N_Texas
review_text: It's ok when it works. I bought this brewer for my RV. First time out it worked fine for the first two cups then started to shut it self off right in the middle of a brew.  You can hear the water starting to heat.. then nothing. Turning it off for awhile seems to reset it and I would get another cup when I turned it back on but that's not acceptable. This issue has presented itself each time I used the brewer.. this last weekend was the last straw.  I contacted Keurig support and they are replacing this unit. IMO the auto shut off timer is not working properly. Since they asked me to send the entire unit back once I receive the new one I would assume this is a known issue. I'll update this review once I get the new brewer and see how it works.  Keurig support is very good. I would encourage you to register your brewer as soon as you get it. They stand by their products and will replace any registered unit under warranty.
review_title: Buggy... keeps deciding to shut itself off..

name: D.J. Sharp
review_text: My husband got me this a a Christmas gift this year and I am in love with it!  I just went and got some more purified water to make my coffee. I read the reviews before I purchased this and saw that someone was using reverse osmosis water in theirs, apparently they didn't read the instructions before they started using it. Do NOT use Distilled or Reverse Osmosis Waters in this machine, they don't have a filter and you will fry the heating unit. Now all I need is an espresso machine and i'll be set! This machine is idiot proof too - I taught my husband how to use it and it only took showing him one time. That is bonified proof that it is (indeed) idiot proof. I promise you that!

name: P. Thompson
review_text: If it were not for a small design FLAW (in my opinion) this would be a great little unit. Flaw: after you put the measured water in the units upper collection reservoir you must allow ample time for the water to drain down into the heating reservoir. If you are too quick to open and close the K-Cup area the water stays in the upper reservoir and THEN is dispensed the next time a person uses the unit, thus overflowing the cup. Since we use this in a B and B situation I had to resort to the "label maker"
review_title: My opinion, a small design flaw....the unit is otherwise excellent.

name: Old Joseph
review_text: We already have a Keurig Hot for everyday use. Because of its compactness,  I purchased this K15 single serving coffee maker for when we travel by car. The resort where we stay in the Smoky Mountains does not have their continental breakfast (including coffee) available until 8:00 am which is way too late for me. Now I can prepare the K15 the night before and have a cup of fresh coffee when I arise. My only complaint is that the K15 water gauge is a bit of a pain to use. I found the K15 much easier to use by purchasing an inexpensive kitchen measuring cup and marking the 8 ounce and 10 ounce graduations with a permanent marker. The measuring cup enables me to quickly add water to the K15 for each serving without carefully watching the odd little plastic water gauges under the lid.

name: Gail M. Gary
review_text: I got this as a gift for my 81-year-old, clear, alert, mom. She's had it for a week. My boyfriend, who has had many of these machines, showed her how it worked. She was able to make it work for two days in a row, then couldn't get it to work for the next two times. I came over and showed her again. She got it to work while I was there, then got it to work yesterday, but today couldn't get it to work again---and she used the manufacturer instructions, step by step, to make a cup of coffee. I am wondering if it is a defective unit. Regardless, it is something my mother no longer wants, although she specifically asked for this machine. She is done with it. Very disappointed! It was a birthday gift too, and I paid $96 for it on Amazon (the platinum color was extra, and that's without the extra shipping I requested to get it to her in a couple of days---I'm out another $25 on that).
review_title: Coffee maker too hard for my mom to use---going back

name: C. Eckhardt
review_text: Love this coffee maker,  this is a replacement we had for years. It was delivered today and upon opening and inspection it was missing the water level cup guide and the overflow button on the drip tray. I contacted customer service at Keurig immediately.  They only listened to half of my issue and offered to send the cup fill part which I will now have to try to add myself. The customer service agent told me it was no big deal to not have the button if it overflows I will see water on my counter . . REALLY???!! LIKE I COULDN'T FIGURE THAT OUT ON MY OWN!! I spent a good amount of money on a new machine and expect it to come from the manufacturer properly made and assembled.
review_title: Poorly manufactured . . Expect better from a Keurig!

There is no guessing on how much water to add when there is a button that says "8oz" compared to the "Brew" button on this machine. Also, it takes a minute for the water to heat up which is a little less user-friendly than the larger machines that are always ready. Furthermore, the red color of it is a little lighter than the picture. It looks lower quality than I was expecting.

name: Jaclyn
review_text: I love my Keurig! I like that it doesn't have a water tank, so we fill it up with water as we use it. There's 3 different water levels you can use, and it's easy to see how much to add. It takes about 2 minutes from the time you start the machine to when your drink is ready! The machine is very easy to use because the lights show what needs to be done and then the brew button will illuminate when it is ready. We love using it for everything from coffee to making hot water for tea. My only complaint is that none of our travel mugs fit under the spout, so I always have to brew my drinks in a normal coffee mug and then transfer it. I use it 2-3 times a day and haven't had any issues, except for the rare times that I forget to place a mug under the spout. the drip tray does a great job of catching the spilled liquid, and it can hold an entire cup so you don't have to worry about it making a huge mess! I really love this machine and highly recommend it if you're looking for an easy to use, quick coffee/tea maker.
review_title: Great little machine for personal use
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

review_text: works great
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: rbcsaver
review_text: Sold, labeled and shipped as a K15, which "replaced" the K10. I ordered the Square Trade warranty, but the bottom plate, with the serial # label is stamped K10. So the purchased K15 model unit on my receipt does not match the model number on the owned unit, and I suspect that they would NOT honor a warranty repair. I haven't any issue with Square Trade, but Keurig shouldn't sell one model number, stamped with a prior model number. Perhaps, the serial number may delineate it as a K15, but doubt Square Trade would have access to that.
review_title: Be aware before you purchase extended warranty for the K15

name: Amazon Fan
review_text: I really, really wanted to keep this. I was very excited about it. You pop a K-cup into a machine, and a few minutes later, you have coffee or tea! But there's one huge problem, for me at least. People talk about the Keurig coffee having a plastic taste to it. I really didn't notice that. But I did notice that after I finished a beverage, my eyes would feel strained. I'd drink a cup or two at night, and then when I woke up, my eyes would again feel strained, like I'd drank some kind of chemical. Sort of like if you wash dishes but don't do it thoroughly, and you ingest dish washing liquid when you eat or drink from the dishes, and you get that sick feeling in your throat and eyes.
review_title: Drinks from the Keurig have a weird effect on me
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: bolo4stars
review_text: This is the greatest of all the smaller size Keurigs, which I have not figured out why there are so-o-o-o-o many sizes. Anyway, I own the silver color that I purchased from Keurig.com for $64.00, which was the coffee maker only, same as this offer. Keurig.com has about seven beautiful colors in this model. I was thinking about buying another in red and putting the silver one in the master bedroom that has been converted into a study. Also, the My Keurig Reusable filter cup fits this model, as well. If you are just wanting a hot cup of water for tea, there is no need for a reusable filter cup, just fill the single-serve tank to the 6, 8 or 10 oz level and be sure your cup is large enough for the amount of water, press all the right three buttons and be patient for a few seconds. The heat-up is very fast. I've using it so far for tea and hot water for soup. Now, as luck would have it, after making this purchase from Keurig.com, I found this same model in my local WalMart in black (only) for $54.00, the coffee maker only. the same as I purchased. Keurig.com [1-866-901-2739] said that WalMart probably had put it on sale. Bottomline, this is one simple, no-fuss, space-saving little coffee maker; but research your stores and Keurig.com and elsewhere for much better prices. What is wrong with Amazon's prices lately? I just don't know.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

review_text: Disappointed as this does not have a reservoir which means you take cup of water each time and pour in. However, this is 'buyer error' as I didn't realize that they even sold these without a reservoir.

name: Jennifer Lin
review_text: I have owned this K-Compact Classic Series (in red) for about 5 minutes now. I've already brewed a cup of coffee. It's PERFECT! I have it on my desk at work and it doesn't take up much room at all! The best thing is (I only use tall cups) But I read that this can only accommodate 5'2" tall cups at the most, so I bought a shorter cup. The cups I use are the ceramic Starbucks cups, with the ceramic lids. They are exactly 6" tall. This cup fits perfectly! I read in the "questions", someone answered it will only hold a 4 inch or so cup. I don't know if they are reviewing a different Keurig or what, but I can guarantee you this thing perfectly fits the 6" tall cup. I'm including a picture so you can see.
review_title: I LOVE THIS! AND IT FITS TALL CUPS!
