name: Collin
review_text: I didn't purchase ours from Amazon but I'm coming here solely for the purpose of warning others from these extremely poor quality units.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Suka
review_text: My original K-10 still works fine after 3 years, but the front plastic cover cracked.  Replacing for purely cosmetic reasons.  The K-10 makes excellent coffee, but I always use filtered water (from the fridge) and higher-quality coffee.  Yes, the needles plug up pretty regularly (there are 3 needle openings to clean -- two on the top, and one in the K-cup holder), but I've learned to keep a straightened paperclip on hand for unclogging duty.  However, I find I have many more clogging issues with the lower-end K-cups that have thinner covers -- when a thinner cover is pierced by the top needles, they can tear a large hole, which allows grounds to leak out and increase the change of clogs. Same caution with the re-usable K-cup -- be sure to opt for a medium or large grind, because if the ground coffee is too fine, it will spill over and cause clogs.  Finally, no reservoir can be a pain if you have lots of guests -- but for one person, I find it the coffee tastes better if made with fresh filtered water as opposed to water that's sat in a reservoir for hours or days.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: W
review_text: My older, larger keurig finally broke after months of messing with descaling procedures, paper clip  maneuvers in the top needle, sewing needle in the exit needle..etc. I swore I'd find a better way to have good coffee. So I decided to become a new French press expert and join the ranks of the coffee connoisseurs....dang at 5am I do not feel like measuring, heating, waiting, cleaning wet grounds and laying everything out to dry. So I tried a simple pour over maker. Which was supposed to be less work but even better tasting than french press. It was not. Still had the measuring, heating, waiting, then mess, and the coffee not better than french press. And with all the clattering I'd usually risk waking someone. Not good!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Vulcan Nomad
review_text: I've had a number of issues with this coffee maker. I purchased my coffee maker directly from Keurig. When I received it, and filled it with water, I immediately overfilled the reservoir. The instructions say to fill it to the 10 oz. indicator, which I feel is not accurate. So following the instructions I found that after the coffee is made, there''s a blue light symbol indicating that it needs more water. I poured more water in. Next cup overfilled. So I called Keurig customer support and the nice person walked me through it. After several cups, the light continued to come on after the cup is made. According to the instructions and the service rep, this is an error. So they told me to send it back and they would send me another.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Scott Satellite
review_text: The Keurig K15 has much going for it but should be avoided due to reliability and performance issues.
review_title: The K15 is a troublesome model to be avoided, choose the K55 instead
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Craig Mandelblit
review_text: Just received as gift today. Machine was missing "Water Level Guide" as described in instruction book. Called Keurig and was informed that they no longer ship them as part of machine and instructions have not yet been updated. So basically we have to get a measuring cup out every time to measure out the amount of water needed. Ridiculous. A comment by manufacturer as new as August 2017 indicated they had the measuring device. Keurig customer service said the change happened a "few months back". Going to return and get a Mr. Coffee K-cup machine that has the measure device. If I could give negative stars I would. Why would a company do such a ridiculous thing to change their design to make a machine less user friendly.
review_title: Design is bad. Recently changed to be not user friendly. Don't buy.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Debra Herman
review_text: This is my second one of these what I called minis because you can put it anywhere makes great coffee it's hot it's fast and I like the idea it doesn't leave water in the reservoir. I've had 2 of the bigger ones and it seems like the reservoirs eventually doesn't work and the mug doesn't completely fill up so it becomes useless after a while. My husband took it apart and it looks like it has to do with the tube that goes  from the reservoir to put the water into the actual device . And I've had two of those and they both did it eventually. This is my second one of the mini because after about after 10 years I began to see that it wasn't filling the whole mug for some reason. I got disappointed in the Keurig and Got  a different coffee maker with the carafe type. Did not like it and I went back with the Keurig mini its inexpensive compared to the other ones. I got another one and I love it!
review_title: Small works great fast and really hot water!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Aria
review_text: I bought this brewer a few weeks ago to replace an older one that recently broke.  I d had it for years.  This one lasted for two full cups of coffee. Now it just drips and you don t even get a full swallow of coffee.  And it s not even hot. Very disappointed more so because it s too lake for me to get a refund plus returning it is such an inconvenience.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: kdvirgo
review_text: Good for a while-but cleaning is difficult. There is nasty build up that gets into small crevices that I couldn't even clean with a q-tip or toothbrush. I also prefer a water reservoir that you can take out and clean. I like the full size one better for cleaning and longevity purposes.
review_title: Good for a while-but cleaning is difficult
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: debhibb
review_text: While I admit I'm usually half asleep when I brew my coffee in the morning, after using this for over a month I still have issues making coffee with this machine.  You have to follow a series of steps to get it right, and if you don't you end up repeating steps or messing up the water level. e.g. you can't power the thing on if the top is pressed down, so I often have to reopen the top and then turn the power on and then close it again and then press Brew.  Twice I've forgotten to actually put the cup underneath after the 5 step process was completed (fortunately, it has a sensor so it doesn't overflow).  A couple times I've failed to press the Brew button in the proper order (e.g. didn't power it on first), and walked away only to find out a few minutes later that my coffee isn't brewing!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Reviewer_Ken
review_text: I have never owned a K-Cup machine before, but had used one a few times while visiting other people.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Chuck Roberts
review_text: I've had 2 of these in different colors. These cheaper models don't seem to work well if you only use them intermittently.  I didn't drink that much coffee and one broke after 18 months, one broke after 12 months. After a while the motor would run but no water would come out. They are good for water pumps for parts though. I also forgot to descale these so lime may have clogged up some tubing somewhere. You really need to descale these once a month. You don't have to use their cleaner, you can use 1 part vinegar to 1 part water solution and run it through the Keurig. Then run plain water through it once or twice to rinse it.
review_title: May not work intermittently. Make sure to descale.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Joyce Renee Lewis
review_text: Perfect for my small kitchen but after 2 years of perfect service it suddenly wouldn't push the water through. Contacted CS @ Keurig & tech had me run a paper clip up the 2 ports under the gasket. This NOT EASY to do because of the constricted space...and it didn't work. But what does work is a fine brush which can be bent to access the ports....and cured the problem. I bought a set of these to clean my hummingbird feeders. Here is the item from eBay:10 PC Tool Multifunction Kitchen Bottle Brush D1Y8( 332194214560 ). Plus it only cost $2.50 & saved me having to buy a new unit. Also, I have been using vinegar water every 2 weeks to flush but am going to start weekly to try & keep this build up from forming.
review_title: Fix for water not flowing through K-cup
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: William L Thomas
review_text: Wife had me size the shelving to accommodate this unit. My fifth Chili Pepper Red single cup Keurig coffee maker is now in failure mode, producing a couple ounces of luke warm coffee after two minutes of pumping and pumping.
review_title: SAVE THE PACKAGING you ll need it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Andromache
review_text: I'm a totally blind customer and this K15 is really fantastic in terms of accessibility. The water level guide has embossed numbers and letters, so if you know how the standard print symbols look, there's no problem reading. In any case, it's intuitive. The six ounces indicator is shorter than the eight, etc. Also, there's a hole in the middle of each gradation, so it's easy to feel when the water level is right.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Susan
review_text: did not purchase this on Amazon but couldn't go without reviewing.  Please do not waste your money.  Both machines I purchased stopped regularly working in less than a few months.  When you google "why my keuring isn't brewing" you find videos on how to take the machine apart to clean out the inner tubing b/c coffee grounds have gotten stuck.  Who the heck wants to do that all the time?  So disappointing since the kids like to make a cup of coffee before school.  and there are days when my spouse needs to leave early for work and doesn't care to make an entire pot of coffee.  My mother has one of the mini K's she received as a gift almost 2 Christmases ago and she's never had the first problem with hers.  These latest models are crap.  Convenient and small but just don't last.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: E Hall
review_text: I have the original Keurig Mini and it is about 7 years old and I use it daily. I am very happy with it and there have been zero issues which is pretty remarkable for a mostly all plastic device. I was recently shopping and stopped to look at the different Keurig's on display which is something I had not done since I purchased my mini. I was shocked at how cheap they all felt. They have to be half the weight of the originals and the plastic bends and creaks making them feel like cheap knockoffs, but unfortunately they aren't. I wanted to buy a K15 for me to use at my girlfriends house, but after seeing and feeling how puny they are compared to the originals I decided to pass and see what else is out there.
review_title: Not what they used to be!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Nonie47
review_text: This is actually my 4th Keurig. First one purchased at Williams and Sonoma 13 years ago. Great machine, lasted 8 years. The second one, 2 years, the 3rd, one year and now the 4th is giving me trouble, purchased in January.  Keurig kindly, replaced it after four months of use because  it failed, AGAIN.  That replace in April is now broke in October.  Come on Keurig , with the price of your  coffee, you should be giving the makers  away for free.  I use filtered water, so their shouldn't be a problem with mineral build up. But I do,  clean it  out regularly.  I shall be looking at another brand.  If it wasn't for the first one, I wouldn't have bought 3 more. Always hoping for a machine like my original. Well, before I even published this review, I broke down and bought another Keurig.  Some people just never learn. I'm giving it one more try!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: MaXimus421
review_text: I love this thing. My sister had one, fell in love with it, so bought treated myself. I'm a pretty heavy coffee drinker. It's compact, easy to use, pretty quick at brewing and hassle free. I like the sleek design of it too and that fact that it's offered in numerous colors. So convenient. Mines been chuggin' along with no problems so far in the couple months I've owned it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Columbus shopper
review_text: Hey! Do you like to chew your coffee? Do you enjoy cleaning up a mess every morning because your Keurig pokes a dime-sized hole in the top of the K-cup and coffee grounds get everywhere, especially (fun!) in your cup? Then this is the machine for you! I have tried several different brands of K-cups and I pierce a tiny hole in the top to release the air (this was a solution suggested in numerous online forums about exploding K-cups) but they still seem to practically burst open in this machine. I bought this for my desk at work because I've had a regular Keurig at home for years and it's been perfect. This mini one, however, is for the birds. Spend a bit more and get the real thing.
review_title: Coffee grounds - a high fiber breakfast!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Paige
review_text: I purchased this Keurig over 5 years ago and I still love it to this day. In the 5 years I've owned it, I haven't had any problems with it. I recently upgraded to a new Keurig just because I was ready for a bigger one and I wanted one that could easily fit a travel mug. Non of my travel mugs fit, so I was using a measuring cup to pour coffee into the machine and to get it out of the machine and into my travel mug. The only other problem I have had with this Keurig is that it sometimes spits water out at you while brewing. It has happened three or four times but not enough to make me upgrade or anything. Overall, I have loved this Keurig and it will move to my office where it will still be used.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Westport Reader
review_text: After about 20 uses, this stopped working. I called Keurig, and they quickly replaced it. But after reading other reviews here, I see they often quit working after a short time. A product that so often needs replacing is not a good product to risk buying.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Nojokes
review_text: What is the fascination with Keurig? I bought one of these because of all my friends' recommendations when I needed to replace my old Mr. Coffee 4 cup brewer. Had the Keurig for 4 months and last week while shopping and picking up another box of K-Cups for $8, I said no more. For $8, you get a sub par cup of "coffee" that barely rivals a poor instant coffee, irregardless of whatever brand of K-Cup you might buy and I've tried a gazillion.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I purchased this item from a non-Amazon site.  It was shipped with samples of coffee pods.  All appeared to be in their original packaging without defects.  The machine failed to brew drinkable coffee.  It was cool and weak.  I tried several pod brands that I knew worked well with different Keurig models.  I looked around on the web and found that some had reported that weak coffee could be associated with the water not being hot enough.  I measured the temperature of the K15 machine I had and machine I had work (which is a larger model) and there was a significant difference in temperature. The K15 brewing temperature was 15 degrees lower.  The customer service department with Keurig was helpful and sent me a new machine that had the exact same problem.  Clearly there is a problem with Quality Assurance and this model. I now need to call Keurig again and complain.  And I know that it is not my problem because a friend from work quit and gave me her own K15 and it works just fine.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Lori
review_text: This coffee maker is so frustrating!  The first couple of months it is fine, then it gets to where it will brew about 1/4 a cup of coffee and to get the rest to come through you have to stand there and hold the button down!  This is even in the instructions on what to do if it doesn t brew the whole cup, so clearly a known issue.  I flew it regularly, in the beginning that solved the issue, now? Nope, still no full cup of coffee.  Our first one started doing this then died.  We got a second thinking the first was defective.  Clearly a design flaw as this one is the same.  Never again, throwing it away and getting a didferent one!  Hate it!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mitch BK
review_text: I had purchased a nice new Keurig with reservoir after my old one became infested with tiny ants that seem to pop up in early spring.  In a short period of time the new one was infested as well. It turns out the warm dark internal reservoir is a perfect breeding environment. (A lot of people seem to have same problem based on internet buzz). I had the K15 in a storage area I had bought for my son when he was living in a dorm during a summer internship. No reservoir!  End of problem. Coffee tastes the same as larger more expensive Keurig and it has a smaller footprint.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Judy
review_text: DONT PURCHASE, READ THE NEGITIVE REVIEWS CAREFULLY.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: geoffrey a velazco
review_text: Piece of junk.  My mom got us this as a Christmas gift because she loves her full size keurig.  I appreciate the small foot print, but the many flaws outweigh this one benefit.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Jennifer Conner
review_text: I received one as a gift, loved it at first but it lasted a year then quit working.I called the company and they said it was clogged due to hard water and gave me some suggestions on how to clean it out.  I tried clearing the needles with a paperclip, ran vinegar through it, bought cleansing cups and descaling kit, nothing worked. I bought a new one and after 2 weeks it did the same thing. exchanged it for another and it lasted only 10 days before it quit working. All 3 seemed to have the same problem, it heats the water but doesn't pump the water through. I returned it to the store, going to try a different brand
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: D.J. Spencer
review_text: I'd never had a Keurig before and never thought I'd like it, but I really do.  Since we live full-time in our RV and I am the only coffee drinker, it is the perfect size for our limited counter space.  Maybe buying the coffee pods seems a little expensive, but there is no waste like trying to brew a small amount in a regular coffee maker.  My only complaint is that the coffee doesn't seem quite hot enough---especially if I add liquid creamer.  My solution is heating my mug of water in the microwave about 45 seconds before pouring the water into the Keurig.  Not only makes the coffee hotter but the warmed mug keeps my coffee warm longer.  I can't believe I resisted buying a Keurig for so long.  I really like it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Team V
review_text: Does NOT have water level display anymore! I called Keurig and they confirmed new models don't have this and can't have it added. So you have no idea how much water is in the tank other than to use a measuring cup. Very deceiving and a very handy feature totally missing.
review_title: Does NOT have water level display anymore!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Lucille A. Edele
review_text: I love the size of this unit and having to make a cup at a time is fine for me since I typically drink 2 cups a day.  However, I am continually frustrated with my K15 because of three unpredictable factors - when I put the water in before opening the lid it automatically leaks in varying amounts, whether it s in the overflow tray or on my counter depending on the size of my cup; though I put in 10oz, the brewed lukewarm coffee can be all different sizes (probably due to the leakage); it malfunctions and sprays water and grounds into all crevices of the unit, onto my counter and into my coffee. Take numerous pass-throughs to get the grounds out.  I originally thought it was the wrong size K-cup but I m careful that its  fits all  or  fits most  before purchasing.  When it happened again yesterday  I just stuck the unit in the sink and  hosed  it out.  I am very surprised at all the 5-star ratings with this coffee maker other than for footprint and color.  I love my red machine but I also love a full cup of hot, clean coffee.  Looking to find another unit to replace this because brewing coffee with a dishtowel over the unit anticipating disaster is not a great start to my morning.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Renee A. Glover
review_text: This is the third Keurig K-cup maker that I have purchased. The other two were the K-55 model: one for my office (gets heavy use but works great) and the other for our house. I decided to purchase one of these smaller units for my son's apartment. When it came in I gave it a try. I hated it immediately. It is not at all intuitive to operate like the K-55. Managing how much water to put in the reservoir and dealing with either too much water or not enough is a HUGE pain. And finally, the coffee tasted TERRIBLE, despite cleaning it according to directions. Using the same K-cups I had been using at work (Starbucks French Roast) there was a noticeable decrease in the quality of the cup. My son didn't care and took the coffeemaker to college, anyway. A few months later my husband decided to purchase a K15 to put on his boat. Same model. Same problems. Unfortunately there is not enough room in the tiny boat kitchen for a full size Keurig, so I take my AeroPress on the boat!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

review_text: Use boiling hot water from the kettle and the coffee will be satisfactory.
review_title: If this used stainless steel parts, I'd give it full five stars.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Jessica Thornton
review_text: Bought this in December of 2017. It's now September of 2018, and I never have any issues with it. It only makes one cup at a time, but as a single woman alone, I really need more than that anyway. I wouldn't recommend it for family, but for one or two people, it's great. I use bottled, purified water. I just clean it by running vinegar and water through it every few months. I got the red one and I love it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: RDM57
review_text: Actually bought this as a gift, and ended up inheriting it.  While it doesn't have some of the features of the larger models, I like it particularly because of its small size.  We've used it for about two years without any problems.  Two caveats though - clean it frequently, and be sure to use ROOM TEMPERATURE water or the unit will not work.  For some reason, cold water affects the sensors and stops the pump from activating.  We keep a filtered water pitcher on the counter near the coffeemaker for this reason.  It's a shame to see so many folks having difficulty with this model.  Maybe this is a faulty batch, or maybe the tips above will help them enjoy the coffeemaker again.  I am thinking about getting a second unit for the office.
review_title: I like it particularly because of its small size
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: D. Isherwood
review_text: Do not buy this unit!  We owned it for 2 months and it stopped brewing.  I called customer service and they instructed me to jam a paper clip into it to clear out old grounds.  I jammed a paper clip around in the needle several times and it did not unclog.  I was told you need to do that every two weeks with this unit, which doesn't make sense to me. I've owned two multi cup Keurigs that never clogged and this one did in months. The Keurig website has instructional videos on how to clean the grounds if that tells you anything.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: bolo4stars
review_text: This is the VERY worst Kuerig coffee maker I have ever owned. The best it can do is to give you a tepid cup of very weak coffee. The Kuerig, in general, is a huge RIP. OFF! I actually have tried several, that means more than three. The only Kuerig that might have any value to the home owner is the commercial Kuerig model. Do not invest in this product.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Cat Owner
review_text: The brewer works as expected, but the taste of the coffee/tea is terrible. I followed the instuctions before using the brewer, but continued to smell and taste a Phosphoric Acid type of odor. I performed 2 more cleanings, ran literally gallons of water through this but it odor and taste were still very bad. I've also tried empting the residual water, which was orange (not brown or coffee) it had a strong Phosphoric Acid smell. Then I cleaned with lemon solution which didn't work, then vinegar solution which didn't work. Finally tried baking soda solution which got rid of the Phosphoric odor, but the coffee now tastes like burnt plastic and I get a headache when I try to drink a cup. I haven't had this issue with other brands, I won't bother with Keurig from now on.  I've only used it to make four cups of undrinkable coffee.
review_title: Every Cup Has Burnt Plastic Taste
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Louann  A Ross
review_text: Purchased this product in January. I ve followed the instructions completely, and have not used any off brand K-Cups per instructions in hopes to keep the machine in good shape. About 3 months in, it started what I m told from kurig support is  clogging . I descale it, clean out the puncture holes etc and it will work again for about two servings and clog up. Kurig refuses to accept my warranty return on this as we keep troubleshooting the machine and eventually get it working again for a short period of time. I would not recommend this machine to anyone. I was hoping that spending the extra money compared to a traditional coffee maker would make my life more simple and convient and instead I m troubleshooting the machine every other morning for an hour just trying to make a cup of coffee. Kurig doesn t seem to want to replace my machine to the warranty is completely pointless. By far the worst customer service I ve ever gotten. I ve resorted to my $10 coffee maker from Walmart that works better then this machine at this time.
review_title: Save your money, machine does not work for long.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Susan G
review_text: DO NOT buy a Keurig!!!  After many years of excellent service from my previous model I ordered a replacement from Amazon, it died in just a couple of weeks.  Amazon replaced it and it died in a month.  They sent me this one and it lasted from December to April and it died.  All the same problem, popping sound and then no heat.  It starts with it giving only small portions of hot water.  Anyway, I called Keurig customer service.  They were so rude I almost hung up but I did get s promise of a prepaid return label to be given to me and it never came.  Called twice.  Do, I am never, ever buying a Keurig again!!  amazon has affordable high rated alternatives.  I do not accept poor customer service!
review_title: Keurig products is poorly made and customer service is nil!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Jacque
review_text: We just bought our second single serve size Keurig. The first one we bought a few years ago failed within the first couple of weeks. Our new one failed after the 3rd cup of coffee! We own 2 full size Keurigs which we love. Both were bought at Costco. One is at least 5 or 6 years old and never misses a beat. We bought one full size one from Walmart that failed within the first month, and both of the small ones we purchased were from there as well. Never again. Sorry, Amazon, but I'm sticking with Costco for my Keurigs. But don't worry - we buy just about everything else from you!!!
review_title: Don't waste your money or your time.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Foxboy
review_text: This is a replacement for the same model which was in use for two years.  Obviously I don't like the lousy two year life, it is too short, but it is still the best on the market (for a single cup maker).  It is too good a machine to be without, for me...but...I wish there were a way to get it not to plug up.  This is a common thing with all coffee makers.  I also bought the descaling solution with the hope it works better than vinegar.  Except for this complaint, this is the best machine, period.  I use only filtered water.
review_title: The best is just ok...short life.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: VB
review_text: This coffee maker worked great...for one month. It was a Christmas gift and broke after only a month of use. It simply wont turn on. Contacted Keurig but I have not been contacted back. I have owned $10 drip coffee makers that have lasted years, and this fancy Keurig could barely last a month? Unless Keurig contacts me back and offers a free replacement I will not be purchasing another unit, and will discourage anyone else from doing so.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mike Beato
review_text: I gave up on my 5-year old Keurig B70. Even after cleaning multiple times, it would not reliably make a full cup of coffee. It was very frustrating!
review_title: Very satisfied with my Keurig K15 after downsizing from the B70
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: arty
review_text: I bought this keurig unit from Target and it completely stopped working, not even turning on no light after 5 months of use. This is the second keurig machine I got that broke within a years time. I got the bigger one from bed bath and beyond and it broke literally after 2 months. It would not pour the coffee into the cup , would just keep making the heating noise and nothing else. Since then I got the ninja coffee bar which I love and will never get a keurig machine again. I did get a knock off k-cup unit for the rest of my k-cups as so not to waste them called chulux and hopefully that unit will last long enough to get me through my 6 boxes of k-cups left.
review_title: Since then I got the ninja coffee bar which I love and will never get a keurig machine again
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Tom
review_text: I have bought two over time.  They don't last.  They end up leaking water on the counter top or don't brew at all.  If you make about 2 or 3 cups a day, it will last about four months.  I do not recommend this poorly designed product.  See other reviews too.  Von Kleiga
review_title: I do not recommend this poorly designed product
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: JBReed
review_text: I have owned this coffee brewer for 9mo and I can honestly say I HATE it. I am the only one in the house that drinks coffee so I saw no need for a big coffee maker and thought this would be perfect.  It doesn't matter how much water i put in, it LEAKS out of the bottom.  While it brews, coffee misses the cup and ends up EVERWHERE. I had to go and buy a new mug for this machine because none of my current mugs fit under the spout so its short and fat. HOW the brewing coffee misses the cup is a mystery. The only reason i continue to use it is because i don't have the money for a different coffee maker.  I wasn't sold on Keruig but decided to give it a try and really wished i had spent my money elsewhere.
review_title: ... brewer for 9mo and I can honestly say I HATE it. I am the only one in the ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: dawn
review_text: I was given this machine as a retirement gift. It lasted four years using it everyday. Then last summer it started not working quite right. It would stop pumping or the pods would explode. We clean it regularly with a paper clip and running vinegar through it. After one huge mess explosion we called and they said they would replace it if we sent a part back. We did and we received a new machine. We clean it even more frequently and after only six months of use the motor wont run again. My husband called them today and they are sending another one but really if this one dies we will get another brand of coffee maker. Customer service is good but that doesnt help when when you dont have a good product.
review_title: Customer service is good but that doesnt help when when you dont have ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: The delivery was great and packaged nicely as a gift. Upon opening my husband reviewed the manual and it looked like it was missing 2 parts. So we returned and got a new one. That one also did not have the 2 parts. Apparently Keurig decided the parts were not necessary, but never updated the manual. Afer talking with them for an unnecessarily long time they understood what happened and sent the parts.  And yes, they were not necessary. This machine is replacing a broken multi cup model. It is ok. I like the smaller footprint. My husband likes the larger reservoir on the multi cup model.
review_title: Outdated manual. Parts in manual do not match parts delivered, but they are not necessary.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Deborah B.
review_text: This machine is a piece of garbage and more trouble than it's worth.  When i get up in the morning I want a cup of coffee.  My keurig started having problems w/in a month and I called the company.  I had to take a paper clip and go into the top to purge the keurig.  So that was fine until I started having to do it about every other day.  This morning I got up made a cup of coffee and then when  my grandson made his, it made about a quarter of a cup.  So I told him how to do it.  You have to have the power off and hold down the brew button to get all the water out
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: HapC
review_text: I have used K15's for years and they have made perfect cups of coffee.  My first one is 6 years old and I have it to my son and it is still going great.  My second one is going great after a couple of years.  I have had Keurig for years, but gave up on the big ones because I'm the only coffee drinker, and didn't need the size.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Antrell Patterson
review_text: I've used this thing 5 times and it died on me. I received as a gift for Christmas and didn't like it didn't hold water like the larger versions, so I put it to the side and still used my larger coffee maker. Well, low and behold my coffee intake has been decreased, so I started to use the Keurig only to have it die on me on the 5th use. Crappy machine.
review_title: I received as a gift for Christmas and didn't like it didn't hold water like the larger versions
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: R. Fetter
review_text: My 2 year old Keurig K10 recently stopped working when the heating element quit. I replaced it with the newer Keurig K15. By appearances, they are the same unit. However, the K15 consistently made a weak, watery tasting cup of coffee that was not really as hot as it should be. Thinking there was a fault in the K15 I had gotten, I exchanged the unit for another K15. But this machine made the same weak, watery coffee. After a search of the internet, I found some retailers still selling the older Keurig K10 makers, and bought one. The coffee made by the K10 is hot and flavorful; just as it was with my previous K10. I believe that Keurig might have attempted to speed up the time for the K15 to make coffee, and in so doing they impaired what could have been another fine little coffee maker. Avoid the K15 unless you prefer weak coffee.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Steve
review_text: I have had some problems with this brewer. Lucky for me I have always filled out the registration card.  I am now on my third brewer in less than two years.  The first brewer started having problems after about three months.  The indicator lights went out first.  Then clear water brewed until half the cup was filled before it started getting dark.  The coffee was very weak.  I called the company and they shipped me a new one within three days.  It worked fine for about four months.  Then it started leaking. And again the cup was filling up with clear water.  I called the company and received my third brewer.  Now it has been working very good for the past six months.  I have noticed in the past few weeks that the brewed coffee is not as hot as it used to be when it was new.  After brewing the coffee I have to zap it in the microwave for about 15 seconds.  If the problem continues then I will call them back again.  For all of my brewers I have performed the necessary maintenance and clean out routines as outlined in the manual.  And finally, customer service is excellent!!  The people are nice, courteous, and very helpful.
review_title: It worked fine for about four months
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I bought this coffee maker less than a year ago. I received a replacement for the older one that had stopped working. It's a good looking machine and a handy compact size for a NYC apartment. However they have removed the Water Level Guide on the newer ones, the reason being that supposedly they have upgraded the heating apparatus so there is no room for the Water Level Guide.  Sounds like BS to me.  You now have to use a measuring cup which is a pain in the neck.  I am not even sure that the coffee is hotter. I learned that you have to descale it OFTEN so it doesn't clog up.
review_title: Expected it to work better than it does
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Glenn
review_text: We have had this coffee maker for about a year. Compared to regular sized Keurig this is a piece of junk! It leaks bad (now up to 1/4 cup on counter). Also have had to disassemble top and clear out manufacturing chips (thanks YouTube for directions.) We bought this based on quality of our home Kuerig, BIG MISTAKE!!! We bought this for our motorhome.
review_title: It leaks bad (now up to 1/4 cup on counter)
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: corrine
review_text: I bought this and started using it two weeks ago when I moved into my new apartment. I make 2-3 cups of coffee a day and today it stopped working! A tiny amount of water comes through. Also when it was working I had to be very careful because it also had a tendency to flood out onto the counter.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: O. ferguson
review_text: I purchased this one because I thought it would last longer than the larger version (K45) of which I purchased 2 of them an they both broke in about 9 months. I reluctantly purchased this one thinking that a with a smaller model there was less to go wrong. But noooo ... broken in less than 1 month.  It now makes a noise like is working but nothing comes out. I'm done with K-cups!
review_title: It now makes a noise like is working but nothing comes out
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: 2chinC
review_text: I've had my Keurig Mini for a couple years now. Thinking about getting a larger (carafe) model. I happened to read a lot of bad reviews of the Mini though. I think it's a great product for apartment/dorm 1 or 2 people. Just needs a couple easy workarounds.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Pablo Cruise
review_text: I have a Keurig at work.  Why I use it I am not sure.  I suppose I keep thinking it is better than the hospital coffee.  All one cup machines I have tried produce poor tasting coffee.  Than includes Hamilton Beach and Nespresso.  If you like coffee that tastes like crap, these are good machines.  My 5 cup coffee maker gives me a superior taste.  Isn't it about taste?
review_title: I suppose I keep thinking it is better than the hospital coffee
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: ellafan
review_text: I bought this model,in this color,last Fall. It has worked perfectly. My chai tea comes out nice and hot. Not weak.Small footprint. Perfect for my computer desk. I flooded the maker a couple of times before I learned how to put the proper amount of water in.From then on,I have enjoyed my cute little Keurig very much.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Brittany Tovar
review_text: A staple for people who live alone! Want a Keurig coffee or quick hot water for tea? This is for you.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: PAR-TEE
review_text: Had to purchase a new model old model stopped working.  My son also just purchased a new one and we both notice the same thing; "the coffee is not as hot as old machine"  NOT HOT ENOUGH...  Stick a thermometer in the cup and the temp registered 140 degrees at it's hottest.  Not the best for a GOOD cup of coffee.  Not happy with the product or the cup of coffee...  Not recommended!
review_title: Older machines produced a better, hotter cup of coffee.  Not recommeneded
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: LCH
review_text: - Messy: The water tank design promotes splashing - if you pour from the cup you are trying to fill the water will splash the way this reservoir is designed.
review_title: - Messy: The water tank design promotes splashing - ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: J.D.
review_text: I bought this coffee maker and it arrived Nov 22nd 2017. Coffee was always fairly weak but it was  "ok" for a quick cup in the AM. Dec 18th it died. Not a fan of this coffee maker
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mickey W.
review_text: I second all the negative reviews here, for this model.  I had this same model for years previously.  Then about 2 years ago, that one finally quit, so I ordered a replacement.  That one lasted about 8 months.  The replacement for that lasted about a year.  Now this one (warranty replacement, suspect it is refurbished) did not work correctly right out of the box.  The first cup of coffee brews ok, but then if you try to brew a second cup, you get about a third of a cup.  I could return it, but I'm finally learning that Keurig no longer knows how to make this product at the same level of quality as they used to.  A shame, because I love the size, the convenience and the price.  Time to go shopping...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Blue Heron
review_text: I always use this simple Brewer, I've worn out several over the years. But I prefer it because it doesn't hold water in the tank like other bigger models. However, the new one no longer has the water level indicators inside. So, Keurig explained they thought it was better, now you have to pre-measure the water yourself. Definitely not an improvement in my book!!!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Dina
review_text: Gave this as a gift in spite of the poor reviews and in 2 and 1/2 months it died. This is the third mini I have gifted this person; the previous mini only lasted a year, but the first one was wonderful. The person who was gifted this only used it for one cup of coffee a day. It does not seem that this product is in many inventories, and makes me wonder if it is being discontinued because of poor quality. Shame on you Keurig if you are aware of  quality problems and are leaving this on the market until the inventories are depleted,
review_title: Gave this as a gift in spite of the poor reviews and in 2 and 1/2 months it died
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: LadyBee
review_text: I so wanted a Keurig and purchased this model thinking it would be good for the only coffee drinker in the house.  For as much as I have to do to prepare a cup of coffee, I'd just as well use my large coffee pot.  After about 5 months and only about 5 uses, I finally gave it away to my sister who was pretty content having it and plans to use it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: M. Aronson
review_text: After reading the negative comments on the web about the Keurig K15 we were apprehensive about buying the unit. However, we took a deep breath and bought the machine.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Sonic DJ
review_text: After several calls to Kurig for tech support I finally had to depart from the K15, right into the trash, the best place for it.  On too many ocassions water would not flow, it would heat up, the pump would run, and nothing more than a half inch of mud in my cup.  Too many wasted K cups and too much wasted time.  Nothing more frustrating than a non working coffee machine when you really need a cup of Joe.  This was a gift and it brought me great satisfaction as it slammed aginst my driveway and flew into a bunch of useless plastic pieces, just as usless as the unit itself.  My only regret is not video taping its demise and posting it on youtube.  RIP my little Kurig.
review_title: Stick with a conventional coffee pot
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Misspent Youth
review_text: It worked for about a week and then just stopped; nothing would come out. I tried cleaning it...maybe some stray grounds were clogging the needle? Nope...it just stopped working. Returned it for a refund.
review_title: It worked for about a week and then just stopped ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Jess
review_text: VERY SIMPLE to use if you follow the exact steps. Only two of us drink coffee everyday and this makes it very convenient
review_title: Great For Small Counter Space Too
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: S. Price
review_text: I finally broke down and bought into the Keurig craze. Bought it at a department store heavily discounted with coupons.  This machine functions really well for me adn is so easy. It's simple to operate and takes minimal space on the countertop. I was excited about that.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mason Wheeler
review_text: When I bought this, I expected a clean, compact, and efficient spin on the original, bulky Keurig that could brew me a good cup of coffee while I was getting ready for class.
review_title: bulky Keurig that could brew me a good cup of coffee while I was getting ready for ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: A. Miah
review_text: Good hot coffee but a little expensive for the quality. The chrome finish is plastic, and it does not seems to have a hot water option without having a empty custom filter in the machine. It is still cost-effective versus purchasing coffee everyday. A great machine if it's on sale. A little expensive over a standard coffee maker.
review_title: Makes a single 10oz hot cup of coffee, no hot water option, quality isn't reflected in price of machine
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: W. Heuter
review_text: Got this for my birthday. Lasted exactly 3 weeks. Same issues as others report here; coffee grounds clogging tubes. My 7 year old Keurig still works so back to that. Disappointing.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: John D.
review_text: Convenient size and nice color. Biggest Con is you can't fit a travel mug under the dispenser. Wanted to love it, but after a week's use, it simply doesn't produce a hot cup of coffee.  Luckily still in the return period so it's going back.
review_title: Convenient, but lukewarm output at best.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: veronsa custard
review_text: I've had way cheaper single cup brewers do a much better job than this Keurig. I've had it for at least 3 years now and it was fine in the beginning but my main issue is that its so hard to clean. The water container is not detachable, cannot get into the inside at all, and cups of coffee have gotten "dirtier" overtime. There's a solution they say you can get to cleanse the inside but I'm fed up at this point. When I get a new one, it won't be Keurig...
review_title: Doesn't perform well overtime, hard to clean
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: MLH
review_text: We are now returning our second single serve machine. The pump wears out in a couple of months.  We are now looking for a different brand.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Quzie
review_text: I love my K15 Keurig.  I only make one cup of coffee every morning, so the 1 cup water reservoir is just perfect for me.  If, by chance, I want another up of coffee/beverage later in the day, I prefer to add another cup of "fresh water" to the reservoir.  Best purchase I ever made in a coffee maker.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Judy Middleton
review_text: I purchased the kuerig K15 and brewed my first cup of coffee to find it only a little hot, not hot enough. I called Keurig customer service and they sent me a new one. The new one was almost the same, not hot enough. I set a stop watch on my first keurig and it took 36 to 39 seconds to heat up before the coffe started coming down. The second keurig was a little better with 62 to 66 seconds before the coffee came down. The second machine is a little hotter than the first, but I still have to microwave it. The instructionbooklet says the keurig will heat up for 90 seconds. My son owns the same model keurig K15 and I timed his brewing and it heats up at 102 seconds. I love it! It's super hot! His machine is 3 years old. How can this be explained?
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: James R Lileks
review_text: Stylish, easy to use, fast - and ceased to function after four months' use. One day it worked; the next it barely produced a hummingbird's tear worth of liquid. Yes, I put a pin in the nozzle. Yes, I did all the things the online help sites suggest. Nada.
review_title: Loved the color. Wish it actually made coffee.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: peter prinz
review_text: I read many of the critics of this machine before I bought it. But I thought people don't know what they are doing.
review_title: After fingering out how it works best, it worked OK
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Scott Fisher
review_text: Easy and convenient, however it never seems to last very long. I have had 3 different units over the course of the past 5 years. Considering how often it is used (about 10 cups per week), how much it costs, and how much a pod costs... it's still cheaper buying the unit almost yearly, than buying coffee out of the house, so I try to keep my view of the quality into perspective.
review_title: Doesn't last long, but still save me money.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: The Coach
review_text: Coffee tastes good, one cup convenience, but like another reviewer said, WHEN PLUGGED IN IT CONSTANTLY MAKES AN AUDIBLE/ANNOYING HUMMING SOUND.  I'm keeping the unit, as I've read several posts on various blogs that this is a common problem.  However... REALLY KEURIG????  Your engineers must know of this glitch, and yet it hasn't been resolved.
review_title: Coffee tastes good, one cup convenience
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Barbara F. Greer
review_text: It does the job for awhile. This my 4th one. They do not seem to last very long. I have not had this one a  year and it is already making weird noises like the last one before it stopped completely. Not a happy camper. Customer service has always been nice but I want a brewer that will last awhile.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Adam Petrone
review_text: Great compact unit. Living in a small co-op with limited counter space this fits the bill. Our old one lasted nearly 5 years of everyday use. Yes you add water for each cup and yes you must remove the drip tray if making a 12oz cup but for it's small footprint it's worth it.
review_title: Small footprint works when space is an issue.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: lakewood
review_text: The big problem with this Keurig (and all Keurig's I have owned) is if you forget to completely open up all components of the machine after use, mold growth develops in all the parts/water lines, etc. One time before a week-long vacation I made a cup of coffee and ran out the door (forgetting to open all the compartments). By the time I came back and made another cup of coffee I spit it out, realizing mold growth had infested all the inner workings/linings of the machine. Had to throw it away. Sigh...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Pinkpaw
review_text: I purchased this in seafoam  green. Super cute! Very disappointed that none of my coffee cups fit unless I took out drip tray.  Also having issue with grounds in my cup. So now it is 3 step process.  Using part from old Mr coffee to hold filter, brewing coffee and then pouring into another cup to drink or take in car.  Wouldn't buy again or recommend.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: MARGARITA RIVAS ORTIZ
review_text: I bought my coffee maker Keuring K15, it only worked for a month. Then he did not turn on again. I changed the power flow, but it still does not work. I do not have how to make the change because I live outside the United States. I feel cheated, I thought it was a good machine.
review_title: I thought it was a good machine.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: E. Golden
review_text: Broken in 5 months. Not stopped up but water does not come out. Pump failure. . Will never get another over priced Keurig when other brands last longer and cost a third as much. Terrible product.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: The Great Oz
review_text: My K15 works great no issues and perfect for 1 cup without messing with a reservoir or tank.  I bought the K15 over the K10 because of The Brighter red color availability.  Even My Box Bottom Said The Model Was A K10???  See Photos.
review_title: K10 vs K15 same unit different colors?
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: jam
review_text: So much I like about this little model, but main drawback is it does not heat the water enough for me to linger over my cup of coffee.  I thought my first machine was defective, so I sent it one back and received a new one.  But this new one is the same.  It  produces water just hot enough for a couple of sips then it goes cold.  I now use an insulated cup so I can get half way through before the coffee is cold.  Keurig, PLEASE figure out how to get this compact model to heat the water so I can enjoy a hot cup of coffee.
review_title: NOT HOT ENOUGH AND DOESN'T EVEN STAY WARM.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: M. Crohass
review_text: I own the current version purchased Dec 2017 as well as an older generation purchased Dec 2012. Two differences stand out in the new version, loss of the water level guide and the drip tray overfill indicator. Both features were useful especially the water level guide.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Josepherous
review_text: I was prepared to give up fuller flavor for convenience.  It delivered on the weak flavor (even when using 6oz of water as suggested), but not on the convenience.  It only worked reliably for 2 weeks, after which it clogged to the point of being non-functioning.  I used it less than once a day.  I imagine some vinegar and water cycling may help, but this does limit the convenience factor if it's this finicky.  I wish I'd kept the packaging, because I don't imagine I can return it without the box.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: pw
review_text: I love my Keurig. It's perfect for someone who lives alone or only wants one cup at a time. I also appreciate the great customer service when I've called with a question or a problem.  I hope you always keep making them - the coffee is great also!  Thanks!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: gabriel
review_text: Purchased this product as a gift and am very disappointed!!!  There something wrong with the unit which causes it to spill coffee grounds in and around the pod area. I would expect this from a $20 or $40 coffee maker which could simply be replaced but a product at this price point and caliber should*make*coffee*easily!!!!!!  I compare this to buying an iron that doesn't heat up!!!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kelsey Hammock
review_text: I wish I would have thought more about the functionality of this machine before I got it. I received this as a Christmas gift per request. I like that it was small and compact because I have a small duplex and minimal counter space. Ultimately I realized I could ve fit a standard size keurig in the space once I got it in there, which was disappointing but was my own fault. But that s not why this coffee maker gets a one star from me. This is the most useless coffee maker I ve ever used. It makes a heaping mess every time I use it. I thought when I first got it that I wasn t using it right or I just needed to adjust how I poured the water, emptied the drain chamber, etc. Three months later it s still a huge problem. Half the time the sensors don t work so I have to mess with it for 10 minutes, turning it on and off and pressing an assortment of button combinations in between before it will sense the water and k cup to actual pour me just one freaking cup of coffee. Also, if you are wanting to make a decent size of coffee this isn t for you. And if you want to make more than one cup of coffee at a time have some time on your hands because on a good, working day for this machine, you still have to continuously refill the chamber, oh and clean up the freaking mess you will make in between. And this isn t the first keurig I ve owned so I know this isn t a user error. I ve thought about selling this off but would hate for someone else to wind up with this god awful machine. And feel bad throwing it away because my mom gifted it to me. Ugh. I should ve just gone with a normal keurig, or at least read the other reviews before deciding on this one. WHAT A WASTE!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Debra Jones
review_text: This was a warranty replacement and it only made one cup of coffee and stopped working immediately.  Nothing I did worked so I had to call Keurig and tell them to send another one.  They said the K15 was on back order so I am to receive the next model up.  Hope this one works.
review_title: This was a warranty replacement and it only made one ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Gene
review_text: Garbage. Bought from big box store for ease of return, just in case. Worked great, for about 2 weeks. Would sporadically not pour water into cup, would just make noise. Returned and got another 1, same model. Same results, worked for about 3 weeks. When it works, it works fine. Theres better products for single serve coffee, stay away from this 1
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: ACE
review_text: I want to live Keurig but I had two of them completely die on me within 6 months of normal use. I'm done with this company.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Doug N.
review_text: I've had four of these and they all made about 40 cups and then the water pump fails.  All of them exactly the same.  At least they are consistent.
review_title: Not as pumped as it should be.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Ronna George
review_text: Had one given to me 5+yrs ago that died on me.  Loved it.  Got a great deal on amazon.com!  For some reason new one had a defect and amazon replacing no charge.  Can't wait for replacement because I need my morning coffee!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: I returned this coffee maker originally because the coffee wouldn't brew. The new one we received worked for a couple weeks and now does not brew again. I am extremely disappointed and dissatisfied. This was a mothers day gift and my mom cant even use it. Please do not purchase this coffee maker as I received two that did not work. Don't waste your money.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Neal
review_text: Love this coffee maker.  Easy to use, easy to clean and fits right on my desk. The best thing is being able to sample new coffees without having to buy a whole pound, or make a lot. I also bought one for my daughter and another for a friend.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Andrea H
review_text: I received my K15 as a Christmas gift from my sister four years ago.  I changed my colors of the kitchen (towels, hot mitts, utensils, coffee mugs, floor rug, etc) to match the coffee maker.  Now I am buying another one so that if/when this one dies of old age, I will have a backup.
review_title: I received my K15 as a Christmas gift from my ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Elizabeth H.
review_text: My K15 quit working in less than a year. It would not power on. Keurig replaced that one with a K10. They said it was the same thing. It is, except the K10's were all recalled. The replacement has also failed in less than a year for the same reason, won't power on. I appreciate that they replace without cost, but it is terribly inconvenient to do without a coffee maker in the meantime. Fortunately I kept my old coffee maker that I had had for over ten years. When I buy a coffee maker I expect it to last for years. If you buy one of these you'd better have a backup.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Cat
review_text: We bought this for our RV where there is very little counter space.  This fits nicely in the little kitchen area and the coffee is just as good as it is with the big Keurig at home.  A good investment and I'm sure we'll enjoy it for years to come.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Babsy
review_text: Just purchased this mini brewer ( silver)  1 week ago because it was on sale......It fits perfectly where I need it to be. This is my first single brewer.. The  whole machine is made of  plastic including the plate where the cup rests on  which has already  become scratched ( keurig is taking care of that)..  The water is not hot enough so it needs to be microwaved especially after adding some milk...I read here that  people seem to be complaining about this..  So  convenience has now become my inconvenience. ... I do not know if I will keep this machine.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: northwoodsgal
review_text: I did not order this from Amazon, but my local Target.  First one brewed for a few days, then stopped working.  Exchanged it for a new one, got 5 cups before it stopped working.  I love the concept & look, but this is a pretty sorry product.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Our K15 stopped working after using it daily for one month. We liked it a lot while it worked. Will definitely not recommend this little machine to anyone and am in the process or finding out what recourse I have.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Retired Chicago Teacher
review_text: I received this as a gift in May 2018.  It stopped working the first week. The water reservoir is confusing and can easily overfill, which results in overflowing. I m going back to the regular coffee maker.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: K. Carmack
review_text: I gave the Keurig to my wife as a gift. She is the only one that used it and it broke after two (2) weeks of use. Note she doesn t drink that much coffee. Not happy. What a POS! I d give it Zero (0) Stars but that s not a possibility...just like the company correcting their problem.
review_title: This is a POS! Don t buy!!!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Bethany & Adam Williamson
review_text: I have had this for 6 years and it just now stopped working. I think it is just because of your hard water and I didn't clean it very often. Great product and brews fast. I would recommend this to anyone who doesn't want anything too big that can brew a simple cup
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: shanika turnet
review_text: I brought this as a gift. Shipped and delivered within 2 days. Great! The product itself is awesome. My parents are so happy I purchased. Packaging was good. Over all good!
review_title: Great! The product itself is awesome
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Sarah Beara
review_text: I could not possibly be more thrilled to have this high-quality, single-cup coffee maker in my private office. No more poorly-cleaned, communal pots of weak, burned Folgers coffee for this gal!!!! MWAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA winning.
review_title: A must-have addition for any dream office!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kathy Linton
review_text: Sadly, VERY VERY disappointed. Began having problems with this Keurig only two months into use; not completing brew cycle resulting in maybe an ounce of coffee at the bottom of the coffee cup.  At three months, the brewing shuts down almost immediately. If I want a full cup of coffee, I have to hold down the handle for the entire brew time (which can take several minutes). I definitely do NOT recommend this product. I have had several other Keurig coffee makers in the past.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Richard Jacobelli
review_text: Wife and me do a lot of road trips. Don't like hotel coffee makers. This little guy gives a fresh cup of coffee each morning without the worry of contamination. Well worth the money.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: SHeryl
review_text: Worked great for about a year. The cleaning n I really liked it until it didntt heat upeedle is ridiculous, have to use a paper clip.
review_title: won't last for a couple years
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kim Maqqy96 Samson
review_text: Terrible. I bought one of these directly from Keurig, and every cup tasted awful. After several cleaning attempts and calling to complain, Keurig sent me a new one. Same problems. This is the weakest, most watery cup of coffee I've ever tasted. Definitely not worth the trouble. Save your money, buy a better model.
review_title: If weak, watery coffee is your thing...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Ana Vanegas
review_text: I actually got this for as a gift for my mom and sister and they love it! The size is perfect for a small apartment and the look is very nice and sleek! This coffee maker is great! It s easy to use and makes coffee really fast which, is perfect for my mom and sis since they are always on a run! I will definitely be ordering one for myself in the future!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Daisy Mercedes
review_text: I ve been using Keurig for years now. I happened to see the K15 while browsing in BBB. I immediately looked up the Specs. How compact! I thought. No water reservoir? No more waiting for the next cycle to add to my cup? Just add a mug full of water for one time brewing? And it takes up less space? This is for me. My daughter bought it from Amazon and I received the next day. I am pleased!
review_title: Compact Makes Full Cup on first cycle
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Marco
review_text: Yes, you can make a cup of coffee.  But the measuring system is primitive.  Most of the time, I have to brew twice to get a full cup.  That or it overflows.  I'd go with another model or brand.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Victor North
review_text: Worked fairly well for the first year or so but eventually lost its ability to heat the water adequately, resulting in bad, warmish coffee. The machine has been a disappointment.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Kimberly
review_text: My work has one and it is god awful, especially compared to the 7 year old K55 I have at home. It's so finicky. You can't put too much water in it or it will spill everywhere but there's no guideline for what is too much. And it takes forever to heat up. I really hate it.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Josey
review_text: I HAVE HAD THIS MODEL FOR A MONTH AND I LOVE IT. WORKS GREAT. COFFEE IS HOT.  ALSO BOUGHT THE K CUP COFFE HOLDER WITH DRAWERS, KEURIG STANDS ON TOP..I AM VERY HAPPY. BEEN A KEURIG PERSON FOR YEARS.
review_title: ... HAVE HAD THIS MODEL FOR A MONTH AND I LOVE IT. WORKS GREAT
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: raybee
review_text: Not recommended. If you want a fast easy cup of coffee while you are running out the door, this works, but if you want flavorful cup that actually tastes like coffee you will be sorely disappointed. Every cup tastes like it has been diluted with water.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: sharon
review_text: I wanted a smaller kuerig so I bought this one in dec.2015.  Today oct. 2016 it went in the rubbish.  Not working anymore. I have a bigger one I can drag out to use.  I loved the smaller one for just one person it was just right.  I doubt I'll buy another one.
review_title: I loved the smaller one for just one person it was ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: V. N.
review_text: Today is Christmas morning  Looking forward to a nice breakfast BUT MY coffee maker just broke that I bought at Amazon in August.  I put in the water but it won't come out and the machine gets really hot. So disappointed.  I was forced to give a star.
review_title: Today is Christmas morning Looking forward to a nice breakfast BUT MY coffee maker just broke that I ...
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Rochelle L.
review_text: I bought this for a friend of mine and they love it. The color is amazing. Great product.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Chris
review_text: I received this as a christmas give last year and it stopped working within 3-4 months. Called Keurig, no problem, they sent me a new one.. the new one stopped working within 4-5 months later. Piece of garbage.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Pauline E. Miller
review_text: Bought the end of April, already not working. Worked great the first 3 month then stopped. I have nearly a hundred pods and now the machine is already nor working.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: serafin a. gaudens
review_text: It is a good product. I had a K10 for some years and then became slow. Decided to buy a new K15.  It is good, but I was surprised that in the bottom metal plate of  the unit, it is stamped,  K10.  The  "K15" is only printed in the shipping carton Labels.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Amazon Customer
review_text: Who drinks 6 oz of Coffee? To fill my coffee cup, I must use 2 k-cups, one as a 6 oz and one as an 8 oz,  Fills the mug, does NOT have a good taste.  This machine makes a simple cup of coffee too complicated, and tastes terrible.  Going to find a different coffee maker.
review_title: too weak or too strong, bad taste
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: suefree
review_text: Great coffeemaker for single person. Live in hard water area so I use the vinegar as needed. When it stopped working I checked out  u tube foe cleaning needles. Works fine.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Ramsey0155
review_text: I've had this model of Keurig for about 10 years. I LOVED it. The problem is, it just died. I'm disappointed to see Keurig has not updated any features in that span off time. I would love to see 12oz cup size available with a shorter wait and possibly cut down on the counter space size? Am I missing a smaller personal coffee maker like this (by Kuerig)?
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: scottmthomas
review_text: I specifically wanted this model for the small foot print. I have one at work also. The bottom tray comes out for larger cups and I pour water into the Keurig from the cup that I am going to drink the coffee from so, I don't understand the comments about water measurement.You only get out what you put in...DUH! I also think it makes a great cup of coffee.
review_title: I also think it makes a great cup of coffee
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Jewel
review_text: I wanted a smaller Keurig for the counter, plus it is so easy to make a simple cup when just one of us wants it. This will be the only one I will ever need, hopefully it will always be available.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Rosalie Donadio
review_text: i bought a replacement for my 7 year old coffeemaker; it didn't get hot ... so I contacted Keurig and they immediately sent a new one; still didn't get hot. Keurig's coffee makers cannot produce a hot cup of coffee!  Disappointing!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Lulu
review_text: If I could give zero star I would. Iam very disappointed after one month the thermostat stopped working and I smell somke I can't return it now it too late .
review_title: Dont buy it save your home from fire
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: aruizOT
review_text: Great, compact Keurig machine. Bought this as a gift for my mom's bday and she has almost no counter space so it was perfect. Works great and she said the coffee tastes great!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Steven
review_text: The best little coffee maker in the world. Hzad the bigger vrersiom and had nothing but problems. This one is flawless
review_title: Buy this unless your making coffee for 5
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: dk
review_text: Bought this thinking it would work properly for $100. Sometimes it would make a quarter cup of coffee when I KNOW I filled it full. Sometimes my coffee would come out with water on top and thick coffee on bottom wth!!! Don't waste your money on this model!!!!
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Gail
review_text: This is a gift for a bestie who loves Keurig. I gave my single serve away. It doesn't brew the coffee. Just forces hot water through the pod. But she wanted a single serve soooo.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Mrs B
review_text: It stopped working after 3 weeks. I ve been maintaining it too. Just stopped making coffee. I m getting muddy water droplets at the bottom of the mug.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Chris H.
review_text: Compact design but performs great. Fast brew time. Good product. Happy with purchase.  5 stars for item. Unhappy with shipping packaging though. Didn't have the option to leave packaging feedback.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker

name: Susan Lyons

name: NicK
review_text: Finally, a product that can effectively heat up my urine and combine it with a k cup of my choice. The possibilities are endless for a pee pee sipper like me. Feeling a little sluggish in the morning? BAM donut shop k cup and human urine. Feeling like cuddling up by the fire with a good book? BAM hot cocoa k cup and human urine. This product has forever changed my life and I hope it will change yours too.
product_name: Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker
